choices: Take their time to think out their plan.
11522.content:
(The story takes place when Oliver and the gang were going to try to steal Jenny's car.)

The gang was in an alley preparing themselves for their plan. All of them had their own ways in preparing. Rita who had the job to look for the right car was stretching her neck to be able to switch from looking left to looking right very quickly. Einstein who's job was to run into the running car Rita chooses was warming up himself by hitting himself against the brick house walls. Tito was warming up his jaws so he wouldn’t have any troubles biting through hard cables. Oliver had only been told to stick close with Tito and look for trouble for him.

And then it was Francis. His part was to act like he had been hit by the car. Even if it was simple task for Francis he still took it more serious then any of the others. Being that he always had have a dream of being a professional theatre actor, Francis had took every opportunity to watch some Shakespearians acting when it was on the TV. He also took and used his spare time to watch how his friends was acting in various situations and trying to imitate their movements and talking.

Back in the alley Francis took the time to make several different positions of him looking like had been hit. There was short direct deaths, and long stretching sections of him in pain. “Aren't you taking this a bit to serious?” Tito asked. “I mean, it only a fake death for about 20 persons.” “Every public performance is worth to put your effort into.” Was Francis answer.

Rita then told them to be ready for the stealing. They all got into their positions as Rita gave the signal. As soon as the signal was giving Einstein went of. As soon as he throw himself against the car Francis took and throw himself into position on the ground. He was lying on his left side with his legs spread out and his tongue hanging out of his mouth.

People was starting to crowd around Francis, and Tito and Oliver was own their way to get into the car when the driver (Winston) also went to see the dog. But as soon as he got out they could all hear a man in the crowd around Francis say. “This dog is just playing dead!” Realising something had gone wrong with Francis part of the plan Tito, Oliver, Rita and Einstein sadly had to escape leaving Francis alone with the crowd.

Francis didn’t know what to do now. His acting hadn’t failed, and except for that one man saying so no other person seemed to see the different between a dog playing dead and a real dead dog. Francis didn’t know who this man was, but if he thought that if he just stayed “dead” maybe he would also left. Other persons from the crowd started to talk back to this strange man. “How do you know it not dead?” “Did you saw it get hit?” “Are you a veterinarian?” “Who are you?”

“I” the mysterious man said in a slightly sissy british voice, “Am Bob Suberson, Special trainer of animal actors. I can tell the difference between a dead animal and one acting better then anybody else. And I can see that this dog is just acting, very good acting mind you, but still not real death.” Francis didn’t know if he should feel honoured for getting the compliment from the man saying that he was really good on acting, or if he was going to get scared of him getting caught any second now.

Like an answered pray from Francis some of the people in the mob started to get suspicious of what the man said. “How do we no you are not bluffing?” “Are you really an expert?” “Can you prove it?” Looking like he just had been asked for a duel the man calmly answered…”Easy.”

He walked up close to Francis (who hadn’t moved an inch since he started laying down.) and started stretching his hands like he was warming up. “If he's really dead then nothing should happen when I do… this!” Bob said and pressed a finger on a certain spot on Francis right shoulder.

Even though Francis tried to keep himself as still as possible all the time, he couldn’t keep himself together when the man pushed his finger into his shoulder. In on second Francis could feel how his whole nervous system got stretched and then doze of. For all the people watching they saw the dog pull his legs together, clench his teeth’s and scout his eyes. To then fall onto his back motionless like his body was made of jelly. His eyes were blinking and he was gasping after air so they knew now that he was alive.

Francis was getting really scared now of what was going to happen to him now. Not only did the people know that he wasn’t dead, his muscles wasn’t working any more so he didn’t have any way of escaping now. Bob Suberson looked at the motionless dog and said, “Don’t worry, you are going to get mobility again in an hour or so.”

“Who owns this dog?” Bob asked the mob. When nobody seemed to make an announcement Bob got an idea that gave him a big smile. Looking at Francis he picked him up and said, “If you don’t seems to belong to anyone, then I'll think I will become you owner. I can see that you have big talents in acting, and I'll make sure that you will be a huge star!” and walked away with the temporality paralyzed Francis.

Hiding in the alley Francis friends had seen everything that had happened. They asked each other what to do. Tito said that they should juts follow the man with Francis and take Francis back as soon they know the location. Rita and Dodger thought more that they should spy on the place and take their time to think out a plan the rescue Francis.

What where they going to do?
11522.title: Francis. The acting star.

choices: Flee to freedom. (Or at least try)
Stay inside the cage like a good doggy.
115222.content:
They followed the man and Francis as they reached a big building with a big sign saying “Pets and Beasts studios (Where the biggest stars are the animals.)”. Peeking out from behind a bush Francis´s friends saw how the man carried him inside the building.

The gang had decided that this being risky they would take their time to think out a plan before trying to get Francis back. But just by looking at the building they saw that this wasn’t going to be easy. It was a very blank looking building with no windows on the bottom floor and doors you would need keys to get thought. On the higher floors where a couple of windows. (This was the office´s.) They also saw that there were ventilation shafts on the roof that maybe also would come in handy. “This will properly take some time to think out.” Dodger said. “I just hopes that Francis can hold out.” Rita said.

Inside the building Mr Suberson placed Francis in a dog cage. “Sorry for having to do this to you.” He said. “But even such a talented creature like you have to start as a “”unknown”” here. But I can guarantee that I will do what I can do to get you the biggest roles that I fix, and if you play your parts right you may even get your own dressing room to live in instead of this dirty cage.” Francis was still pretty unsure of to feel in the situation that he was in. He was right now trapped in a cage in an unknown place with a man he didn’t know at all. But the way the man spoke was starting to make him feel (oddly enough) safe. He seemed to care for what was happening to him and to help him become the star that he had always dreamed of to be. Also he seemed to care for him feeling good by wanting to fix him someplace better to live then in a cage. If he really was just a mean man after money he would just left him to live inside there. The bad thing was that he still felt paralyzed. But the nice man made sure to calm Francis on that to. “Don’t worry, the effect of my pitch will soon end. Now I have to take you to my boss.” And with that he started caring the cage to his boss room.

During the transport Francis got a chance to see how things looked here, and it actually looked pretty good. He saw all kind of animal doing movie parts, but his focuses where mostly on the dogs there. He saw dog that was being trained, filmed and then rewarded with treats for their good work. He saw dogs that had their own trainers, dressers and even (just like Bob had told him) own dressing rooms with their names on them. Also during this traveling he started to feel his movements coming back just like Bob had told him. He was then putt down by him when they arrived at his boss’s office. “I have to leave you outside because our boss is “”ironically “” allergic to animals. And so Mr Suberson left Francis alone outside while he was going to convince his boss to give Francis a chance.

During the waiting Francis had got back all of his movement again. While stretching himself he discovered that the cage wasn’t locked probably. This meant that he had a chance to escape from the cage and try to get out of this building. But if this man really wanted to make him a star then this was his once in a lifetime chance to make his dream come true. What should he do?
115222.title: Francis enters the big house.

1152222.content:
Even though it looked like the only true chance for Francis to escape from his kidnapping he still thought through what had happened so far. A man had walked up to him while he was playing dead. He had seen through the act but praised him for his ability to act. Then he had taken him against his will to an unknown place inside a cage. He had been saying that he was sorry for doing this and been giving promises to help him get a better place to live in then the cage. Although it looked like the mans actions and will seemed to be to let the world see Francis talent. So taking a big risk (from Francis perspective) he decided to stay in the cage and see what would happen.

Inside the office Francis “kidnapper” Bob Suberson was having a talk with his boss Donald Ford. Donald or Mr Ford like his staff called him looked just like an average boss. He seemed to be in his fifties, was bald, a little bit overweight. His emotion side was a bit different. He is a nice against his employers and the animals (even though he is allergic against some animals like cats and dogs.) but he could also get really aggressive when things don’t go as he planed, or not after “schemat”.

When Bob made his entrance into the office he saw his boss sitting behind his desk doing a phone call, and he seemed a bit upset. “Is that so? Well I can tell you that if you don´t bring he a male dog soon I´ll make sure you wont be able to get a job again!” slamming the “telefonluren” when he was finished. Bob felt a bit nervous talking to him now.

His boss noticed him now standing against the door. “Oh Bob, Come here take a seat.” He said a bit more calm now, “Vilket” also made Bob feel calmer. “I´m sorry you had to see that.” Mr Ford said while Bob took a seat. “But I´m in a bit of a jam right now. You see I´m really in need of a male dog to play in an important project, and all I get to hear is that all the dogs we have is filming right now. The shooting is this afternoon and I´m starting to get really desperate.” “Well Mr Ford.” Bob said. “I happen to get my hands on a male dog this morning.” His boss got a bit of hope in hearing this. “Is it an experience dog?” he asked. “Well, probably.” Bob answered. “What do you mean probably?” his boss asked him a bit worried. “You see…” Bob said pausing a bit before saying. “I actually found this dog on the streets ownerless.” His boss was staring to get angry but controlled himself because he knew Bob was confident enough to not do this without having a good reason for doing things. (Even though this was pretty hard to get.)

“And can I ask what your thoughts are in putting an inexperienced dog that you found on the streets in a high budget production like this?” he asked. “I know this seems crazy from your perspective, but when I saw this dog on the streets playing dead in front of a crowed I could swear that I had never seen an ownerless dog fooling an audience like he did.” Bob answered. His boss looked still unsure and Bob continued without giving his boss a chance to answer. “And I swear that I´m seeing so big potential in that dog that if he would fail and ruin the whole thing I will take the whole blame for it, and I would let you make sure that I “Wont be able to get a job again.””

His boss was silent for a moment. Inside his head he thought about how risky the whole thing would be if let this dog have the role. But he know that Bob always would know what real talent is, and this must be s a really talented dog he had found if he was prepared to risk his own job for this dog. Trusting in a good worker Donald Ford said. “If you are really sure that he can do it, then he can have that role.
Bob was all exited over hearing this. He knew that he wouldn’t probably do the same if he was the boss so he was just happy for his and Francis sake. After shaking hand with his boss he went outside again to find Francis in his cage. “I have good new and bad news.” He said to Francis. “The good news is that I got a role for you, and it is a big thing.” Francis eyes getting filled with enjoy of knowing that he had chosen the right thing, and that this man was trustworthy. “The bad news is that the shooting is in just a couple of hours and we have to rehearsal on stage “Direkt.” Francis got a bit stage fright now. He wanted to get a chance to do things, but this was getting a bit to quickly for him. But he had had his chance to escape and didn’t take it, now he has to do this.

What where they going to film?
1152222.title: Stay inside the cage like a good doggy.

choices: Just ignore him and do your part.
Make this commercial a living hell for him.
11522221.content:
When Bob explained for Francis what it was it seemed easy. He was going to be in a commercial for Bulkim dog-food. He was going to sniff at two different dog-foods and then chose the one that was made by Bulkim. “Seems like nothing hard.” Francis thought, “Just act like if it is a real battle in your mind in choosing and everything will be perfect.”

What Francis hadn’t thought about was his counterpart in the commercial. In the commercial it would be a female dog that would be “talking “into the camera about how much better Bulkim´s dog-food is compered to it´s competitors. The dog wouldn’t really talk. She would just move her mouth and a human female would do the voice. The counterpart was going to be played by none other then Georgette. (Being that she´s the winner of “56 blue ribbons, 14 regional trophies and six-time national champion.” It wouldn’t come as a surprise that was staring in a high paid dog-food commercial.)

She was getting ready for her makeup when she saw Francis walk in. (Being that this is a fictional story Georgette never met Oliver or the gang before.) “What on earth is that?” Georgette thought. Being a prizewinning beauty and a rich diva she was expecting something along the line with a handsome and prizewinning Greyhound racer as her co-star. So seeing this “dog-looking” thing was a big scandal for her. “Are they serious with starring that ugly sack of slum as my co-star? He doesn’t even look like he has been probably cleaned for a loooong time.” Then she saw how his trainer was showing him the script and started to tell him the scene. “He hasn’t even read the script? What kind of amateur casting I this!?”

As Francis got a really quick makeover/washing, Georgette thought about what to do. She could just take and do her part, not thinking about this stranger. Maybe they wanted to have him just so they could just make Georgette look better in comparing.

But if that wasn’t the case then they did this just to test Georgettes temper. The thought of letting this ugly, stinking, talentless stranger come here and try to be like the big stars just made Georgette mad. “If he wants to be a part of this then he will have to fight for it.” Georgette thought.

What way was Georgette going to go?
11522221.title: A dog-food commercial.

115222212.content:
Georgette was not going to just let this slip by. She was going to show that dog who´s the real boss here. But how was she going to do it? Almost as an answer she heard how the stranger dogs stomach growled a little. Then she got an evil looking smile across her face because she now knew what she was going to do.

In the commercial the male dog is going to eat the dog-food before Georgette does her part. This means that even if they would have to do another take, the food from the first take would still be in him. “If he want dog-food, then he´s going to get lots of it.” Georgette thought.

When it was time for the first take Francis did his part, maybe eating a little bit more food then he was suppose to, but he was really hungry and this could be the only food he was going to get in a long time. As for Georgette she pretended to get a cough so they had to do a retake. Francis actually got a bit happy for this because this meant he would get a little more food to eat.

During the second take Francis was keeping himself closer to the mass he was suppose to eat, but still eating just a little bit more because he was still hungry. This time Georgette pretended to trip as she was walking into the shoot.

Having to do a third take Francis thanked his lucky star for this chance of him getting a prober meal. “May she never get the scene right.” He thought for himself. Georgette was happy that her plan seemed to work so far. The stranger dog was getting fatten up and didn’t seemed to suspect anything. “Just a few more takes and then he´s probably down for it.” Georgette thought.
115222212.title: Make this commercial a living hell for him.

1152222122.content:
Take after take went on and to Georgette´s frustration this strange dog didn’t seemed to quit. Georgette had tried everything. She had sneezed, caught, tripped, forgot to speak, been too late in her entrance, everything. She was starting to run out of ways to fail the scene.

Francis was still going strong but with much more pain inside him now. Having done over 30 takes had been starting to take hard on his stomach. It started nice with one portion. But then the portions started to become a pound of food in him, and that grow into two pounds, and then to three pounds, and then to four pounds. Until he finally had been eating 20 pounds of dog-food. It really showed on his body too because he started as an underfed hungry dog, that now have a stomach that stretched out a feet. Luckily for him the food was placed on a set piece that sealed of Francis bloated body from the cameras. He had also gone from loving the dog-food to almost getting sick of eating it. But even thought all of this Francis still eat the food with the same dependency in every scene. Giving his all for the scene.

For the 31th take Georgette was finally done with failing. She had used all her tricks, and couldn’t figure out any more to do. So she had to simply find herself beaten this time, and just do the scene. During the take she got surprised to see that her counter star didn’t show any sings of him being full. He eats like he hadn’t been eating for the entire day. Georgette had to admit that it must take really good acting for him to still keep a straight face considering all the food that he had been eaten.

When the director yelled “Cut!” and “That´s a rap.” Francis could finally quit his acting and show how his body really felt. He fell onto his back and squirmed and clouts his paw around his bloated stomach. Being that he had lived his whole life on the streets starving made the feeling of being full a whole new experience for Francis. He felt pain for being overstuffed, but he also loved the feeling he got before he had eaten too much, and he didn’t want to do anything else then to get to try that wonderful feeling of being full again.

What would happen next? Will Georgette try to get revenge on Francis for not failing the scene? Or are we just going to go on with Francis next protect?
1152222122.title: Francis keeps it together.

11522221222.content:
As everyone else was walking of the set for lunch break Francis had to be carried away by his trainer because of his over stuffed stomach."Wow, you really went all in for that acting," Bob said as he had to really use his strength to be able to lift Francis. "But this really shows that you have the guts for what it takes to be in this industry." He said in a playful manner as he poked Francis belly to further illustrate his pun. Doing that made Francis let out a small howl of pain by how taunt his stomach felt. "Ops! Sorry there little friend. Didn't mean to hurt you." Bob apologized before putting Francis back into his cage. "Now make sure to get some good rest now. You're going to do another tv thing in just a few hours."

Francis took his advice and immediately fell asleep. Having all this food inside of him really made him wanting to rest and digest it. While laying asleep and not moving Francis had to admit that he liked the feeling in his stomach now. It was still crowded and noisy, but after having a chance to digest it for some time the pressure inside had been lowered and the whole size of it was now a bit less streched. Now when he was feeling on it with his paws Francis could feel the warmth and comfort with being stuffed of food. Once again reminding himself of how he had been at the point of starving for most of his life Francis loved even more the feeling of for once being full. "If I ever got the chance to once again eat a lot, I have to remember to stop eating here. Going futher would only make it hurt again." Francis thought to himself.

After some wonderful hours of sleeping of his meal Francis was awaken by Bob who had fixed a new job for him. As he got out from the cage both he and Bob could see the result of his sleeping. They could both see that while shrinking during his sleep Francis stomach was still very bloated. Still Francis didn't seem to either feel any pain from it or having truble walking on his own now, so Bob let it be. "I think it will take a whole night's sleep to make your stomach disappear completely. But for now I think we need to get to the audition I fixed for you." Bob said as he lead Francis to the place where the audition would be.

Getting there Francis saw that the tv-series Bob was trying to get Francis on was...
11522221222.title: Resting between projects.

choices: Cut to the gang, planing a way to rescue him.
115222212221.content:
Downtown Alley, the most exclusive and well know tv drama that exists! It's about the life of the aristocracy class living in the Victorian era England. It is one of the most watch tv dramas of present time, and Francis favorite show. For a long time he had been fantasizing about being a part of it, and could hardly believe that he was standing among the show's sets. Feeling his stomach still being a bit hard on him, he cursed himself for not being in his best shape for his big opportunity.

Of in a corner there was a group of men arguing, and by the sound of it, it felt very important. Bob knew that those was the men he was suppose to show Francis to, but hearing how much into their discussion they where he decided to just stand next to them and wait.

Being just next to them he heard them say things like "How are we going to show it?" and "We need something to symbolize with.", before suddenly hearing one of them shout "What do you want?!" right at him. Taken by surprise Bob moved back seeing that he now had all the men's attention. "Can't you see that we are in an important discussion about finding an important piece to the story?" One of them asked upset. "Well, I didn't mean to disrupt you but I was suppose to show you the dog that might be able to play the part as miss Hardembell's pet." Bob said and asked Francis to come to him.

Feeling more then a little nervous Francis walked up seeing all of these great men that was the whole reason for this show to be a success, and having them judge him. While all the men was just quiet for a while examining the dog in front of them, Bob tries to help selling Francis into it. "I know that he looks a little chunky, but he had an incident with a dog food commercial, and..." Was all Bob could say before he heard them shouting. "He's perfect!"

Both Bob and Francis was not prepared to hear that. They both thought that he would be used playing the pet dog to some nameless extra standing in the background, and here they are told that he would be perfect for the part as the leading character's dog. As all the men was on them begging Bob and Francis could hear them say things like, "You must let us use your dog." and "He would fit great into the settings. " All Bob managed to say was, "G-Great, I will just make sure to get him silm again and bring him back here." Before getting cut off by the men. "No!" "Don't do that!" "That's the thing!"

"What?" Bob asked confused. "You see," Said the man who was the head writher for the show. "The show centers around how the upper class is living at a much more richer and comfortable life then anyone else, and we have been wondering on who to create a great symbol for that. Something that would throughout the whole season show the changes that the aristocratic living would give, and we think this dog would become the perfect symbol for that. He would be givin as a pet to Lady Hardembell, looking around the normal size of what that kind of dog weights. And throughout the season he will gradually gain weight, and show what a spoiled lifestyle would do to him. What do say about that? Can he do it?"

Bob took a moment to speak with Francis about it. "I know this is probably the greatest opportunity you ever can get but that also mean that you will not only be forced to have this kind of body, but even getting much larger then you are now. Are you sure you really want this?"

After a few moments of thinking Francis decided to go full in for the art and nodded to Bob. "Okay buddy, if you say soo." Bob said and turned back to the men. "Francis have agreed to play the part." He said, much to the men's delight. "He will be a perfect for the part, he will not regret it." He said before letting Francis back to his cage to sleep. "Have a good sleep now Francis. Tomorrow is the start of show business." Bob said before leaving Francis for the night.

As he was getting himself comfortable he couldn't help but to think for the first time since being placed here what his friends where doing right now. Where they trying to form a plan to save him, or had they already forgot about him?
115222212221.title: Downtown Alley.

1153.content: How will the biggest dog become even bigger?
1153.title: Einstein

11532.content: What other story do you want?
11532.title: Free Choice

115321.content:
(This story takes place when Oliver and the gang tried to steal Jenny's car.)

It was the morning of a new day. Oliver and the gang made themselves ready for todays job. Unknown to Oliver their job was to try and steal a car. For all the other they know their positions. Rita would spot the car they would take. Einstein was going to hit the car with his thick head. Francis was going to act like he had been hit, and Tito was going to highjack the car. Oliver's part would be to look out for Tito.

At the sidewalk of the street a Golden retriever girl named Cindy was getting her morning walk with her owner. She saw the dog gang with the cat hiding in the alley and she knew by the look of them that they seemed up too no good. She decided to make her owner stop by pretending that she needed to sniff a lamppost. As she watched them preparing for something she couldn’t stop looking at the big tall dog. While the others seemed like they where criminals that had done bad things before, this dog looked so innocent. He didn’t looked like the brightest one, but in his eyes she could feel that if he wasn’t in the wrong company he could probably have a nice family to live with.

When Rita gave her signal Einstein went of. At first Cindy didn’t get what was going on, but then she got shocked to see Einstein rush towards a speeding car and hit his head at the side. Francis was quick to lay himself in position so it looked like he was the one getting hit, but Cindy saw how it really went. She couldn’t believe that they made that Great Dane hit his own head against a high speeding car. “He could get brain damages, or even die” she thought. All she wanted to do was to get free from her leash and go to see if he was okay.

She would get her chance almost immediately after thinking that because while Francis was fooling the mass in that he was hurt Tito and Oliver had made it into the car trying to high jack it. Tito told Oliver too look in case the owner was coming back to the car, while he was going to find the starting cables. Oliver accidently turned the keys while scouting. At the same time Tito bit into the starting cables, leading to him getting electrocuted and fly across the street like a rocket.

The chaos the mob gave was the perfect time for Cindy to break free from her owners grip and try to find the Great Dane. During the chaos the other dogs tried to make an escape into the alleys. Einstein that still was a bit dizzy after the hit missed this and was left alone, not knowing what to do. That's when this beautiful girl dog came up to him. “Oh my gosh! Are you head okay?” Was the first thing Cindy could think of to say to this stranger dog she just meet. Einstein who was know to be very polite to answer a given question said “Yes, I'm used to it now.” Before he understood that he talked to someone he didn’t know. “Who are you?” Einstein asked. “Oh, sorry. Forgot to tell you, I’m Cindy.” Cindy said. “My name is Einstein.” Einstein said. After a moment Einstein understood that a completely unknown female had walked up to him and started talking to him without any reason. “So? What did you want?” Einstein asked. “Well, I saw what you did there before.” Cindy answered. She then saw that Einstein couldn’t put what exactly she had seen him do, so she said “That you smashed your head against the car.” “Oh yeah.” Einstein said looking like a light bulb had appeared above his head. “I did that. I actually forgot about it. Must have been the hit in the head.”

Cindy couldn’t help but giggle a little at what he said. He was so sweet and kind in his voice just so lovable of his own stupidity. But she felt a bit down again when the thought about how he let himself be treaded by the other dogs returned to her head. Einstein who saw how she changed emotion asked what was wrong. Knowing she couldn’t lie to him Cindy said, ”I like you.” Einstein got a bit confused by her expression and what she said so he asked, “Where you sad about that?” Cindy feeling even more sorry for him still not understanding said flat out, “I think you deserves a better life!” Einstein was still a bit clueless while letting Cindy continue. “I think you are a kind, gentle and even… sweet dog. So much that I even think I love you.” That part Einstein understood eminently, but he was to surprised to interrupt Cindy who continued. “I felt so bad when I saw such a good being treated like he was nothing. I'm willing to do anything to give you better life.” Einstein started to feel like it all went to fast. For just a minuet ago he had just meet this dog, and now she was all over him about love and all. But before he had a chance too say anything he got shushed by Cindy who was listening to something.

“Cindy! Cindy!” Cindy could hear her owner call for her. She quickly turned back to Einstein and said, “I don’t have more time. If you want to meet me again do it at “”Blackpearl street 7 in one hour.” And with that she leaved Einstein alone not being able to say anything back too her before he heard the voices of his gang shouting after him.

As he made his way back to the gang he wondered if he was going to alone visit Cindy in one hour as she wanted, or should he tell his friends what happened?
115321.title: Good old fashion love.

1153211.content:
Almost an hour since the incident on the street EInstein found himself standing outside the door to the house on Blackpearl street 7 waiting to met Cindy. He didn't know why he was doing this. Why he had leaved his friends and family unnoticed, and walked his way through out the city to this adress all alone. Was it something he saw in this female dog that made him do it? Or was it that he just had a habit to follow all kinds of orders that was given to him, without any second thinking about it? No matter what he now stood there now, waiting and waiting.

After waiting for a while he heard a knock on the window on the left side to the door. Looking at his left side he saw Cindy on the other side waving at him. At first he didn't get what she wanted and just waved back to her, but then he saw her doing gestures with her paws telling him to walk around into the alley next to the house. Doing so Einstein saw her appear in another window that was standing a little open, making it possible for her to speak with him. "I'm so glad that you came to see me again." She said. "Well, you asked me to come here, so I did that." Einstein answered like it nothing strange to do what strangers told him. "My owner right now is gone for work and I have the house all by myself." Cindy explained, "The door on the front is locked, but I know another way to get you in." Cindy said as she used her paws to fix the clasp to open up the window. "There's a trashcan standing over there, if you took and brought to next to under the window you should be able to reach in." Einstein did just that and put the trashcan under the window, stepped on it, and managed to reach up to the window and get inside.

Once inside the great dane found himself standing in a pretty normal kitchen. For Cindy and most other dogs with homes it was nothing special, but for someone like Einstein who had only been living on the streets and had only had the houseboat as any kind of home this was amazing. Everything was so crystal clean, and there was so much space that didn't have any junk laying around. But what really caught his attention were when he saw that Cindy not only had her own personal bowl to eat from, but also one for the food and one for the water.

“You have been staring at my bowls for a long time, are you hungry?” Cindy asked. “No thanks, I had a whole orange and some pieces of bread so I should be good for the day.” Einstein said polite. “That is not anywhere near the amount of food a dog of you’re size should be consuming daily.” Cindy said shocked. “It isn’t?” Einstein asked confused. “That’s the kind of food I’ve been eating ever since I can remember.” “Then we need to change that now.” Cindy said as started to pull out bags of dog food from the kitchen cabinets. Einstein just stood there, not understanding what she was doing.

When she was done she had two big bags of dog foods standing next to her. They both stood higher up from the ground then Cindy, and they both had their own labels on them. “Okay,” Cindy said, “I’ve got here on my left Cridgers super-beef. It’s a type of dog food that has been made to give the rich taste of pure beef in their biscuits, their small at size but rich in calories. So they are recommended to eat in small portions, as they will put on some pound in big portions. The one on my right is called Maderins hypno-chow, their name comes from the food being spiced with chemicals that makes the food very addicted. While smaller in calories compared to the super-beef, these small chows will make you so obsessed with eating them that you wont stop until your stomach is full.”

“So what will you choose?” Cindy asked Einstein. “Wait. You want me to choose the food for you?” Einstein asked dumbfounded. “No, not me. It’s for you.” Cindy said. Einstein was quiet for a moment, trying to think if he had heard right. “You-You want to give you’re food to me?” Einstein asked. Cindy responded with a nod. This was all very strange ways of acting for Einstein. As he had learned from being raised on the street you don’t share things like this. When it comes to food you always keep as much as you can for yourself, just for the sake of survival. So seeing this female dog that he had only knew for about a couple of hours now stood here offering food to him that was almost as big as she was, were a very big contradiction to everything he had known before.

He was woken up from his thoughts by a voice saying, “Are you going to choose one?” Looking back at Cindy and the bags of food again, Einstein started to feel something new in his body. He felt hunger. Hunger for almost never in his live being able to have a meal big enough to satisfy him. “This was it now.” He thought, he was finally going to be able to satisfy his own needs for once. And the only thing left for him to do was to choose which food he would like to have as his meal.

What food does he choose?
1153211.title: A very interesting meeting.

choices: Yes, and they have been really worried.
No. Nobody has been thinking about him at all.
11532111.content:
"If I have to choose I guess I've always wanted to try Beef." Einstein said.

"Then Cridgers super-beef it is." Cindy said as she put the other bag of dog food away. "I would have loved to share you the food with my food bowl," Cindy said as she open up one of the dressers. "But given your size..." She said sticking her head inside, grabbing something with her teeth's. "I think this will do you better." She said before dropping a big bowl meant for baking in front of Einstein. She then ripped a hole on top of the dog food bag, before pouring it into the bowl. About a fourth of the bags content was used before the bowl was filled. She then put the bag aside, looked at Einstein and said, "Dig in."

At first Einstein still was unsure of doing this. He still felt that he was stealing the food from her instead of seeing it as a gift, but after Cindy instead told him "Eat it! It's an order!" In a serious bossy way, Einstein started immediately to dig in. As he was starting to eat he still felt unsure if he should do this, but after only one chew and a first taste he was gone. He didn't think about morals or consciences or anything. All he could think about was eating, and it felt wonderful. The taste, the size, the freshness, everything about this food was better then anything else he had ever had in his life. He realized that after only a few mouthfuls he had been eating about the same amout of food that he would eat a day. It felt insane for him. How he could have managed to live a full live on his previously diet seemed like a mystery for him now.

As Cindy looked on as he chowed down she coudn't help but to feel "Strange" inside. What exact she felt she couldn't say yet, but it was something. She had felt things before but that was mostly about how badly she felt for him. Now it felt like the opposite of that, but why. Was it to see how happy he was now being able to eat a real meal? Was it the good conscience of helping someone in need? Or could it be beacuse of that bulging belly that he started to get?..."Wait, what bulding belly?!"

Taking another look she saw now that her friend had started to get really big and round down there, and looking over at the bowl she could see that he had only been getting halfway done eating. "Geez! I knew those things got a high calorie value but this is insane. Does he even chew them before swallowing?" She couldn't stop staring at it, and she didn't know why. He was a big dog a big size was to expect, but this? Maybe it's that he looks more thinner overall compared to other great danes she seen, but still it was crazy. She just couldn't stop staring at this thing still growing.

Hearing some sloppy sound coming from the bowl Cindy took a quick.to see that he was almost done. "Have I been staring for so long?" Cindy thought as she quickly raised her eyes as she got eye contact with Einstein again. Even though he wasn't saying anything she could tell by his face that he was happier now then ever before. "Did you enjoy that?" She asked. "Oboy, that was the greatest thing I have ever eat." Einstein said, his jaws acting almost numbed after his intense eating. "I can clearly see that." Cindy said mumbling to herself while taking a quick look at the belly again. "Did you say something?" Einstein asked. "Eh...You're drooling a little." Cindy said seeing a small drool escaping from his tiring jaw. Einstein quickly took and tried to pull it in again, and Cindy made sure to not stare at his belly anymore. "If you would like to you could come back around the same time the next day, if you would like that?" She asked. "To get more food from you?" Einstein asked, and Cindy answered with a nod. "Then yes, I would really like to come back."

All of the sudden an important thought appeared inside Einsteins head, and he said out loud, "I need to get back to my friends!" Looking at a bit shocked Cindy he said, "Thank you for the food, but my friend may think I'm missing and I need to get back." "Okay, you can just go out the same way as you came in." Cindy said and pointed to the window. Climbing up the sink to reach the window felt harder for Einstein, but he couldn't tell why. Cindy could see why very clearly, and that's his new bigger stomach getting in his way. Still Einstein managed to get to the window without bigger problems, that is until he tried to get trough the window. With his new wider figure he only went halfway through before getting stuck in the opening. "Could you help me CIndy?" Einstein asked, "It looks like the window is much smaller on this side." Ignoring how stupid that sounded Cindy climbed up to help him, only to be greeted by a amazing view. Being stuck halfway through left Einstein's front side hanging outside, and his backside stuck inside. For Cindy this meant that when she got herself up to the sink she got incredible close to Einsteins hindlegs, butt, and mostly his big hanging stomach. It looked so inviting to her. Just like something out of a exrotic dream that she had have in her head ever since she first saw Einstein in this state. "Could you give me a push?" She heard Einstein say from the other side. Given the small space on the sink plus that Einsteins hindlegs still stood there taking space, that leaved Cindy to only one way of helping. By pressing her face into his swollen gut. Feeling like she was living her dream right now Cindy had to fight her inner dirty thoughts and focus on helping Einstein, but pressing her face into the warm soft underside of this dog was enought for her to start panting heavily. "Don't give up Cindy, I know you have the strenght to do it!" Einstein shouted, thinking the panting was from her being exhausted trying to push him. "Oh, If he only knew:" Cindy thought as she tried to fight her own horniness which wasn't easy. By having her face pressed into him and not being able to see, smell, and feel anything else then his full stomach made it almost impossible for her to just start making out to it. When she finally managed to get Einstein through the window Cindy feel down on the floor and panted hard. Hearing it Einstein simply said "Thanks! You can rest now." Before heading back to the houseboat. Still laying on the floor Cindy couldn't belive that she had become so turned on by this dog having a big gut.

As he headed back he couldn't stop think about how strange she had been acting towards him. How she had been looking at him, and talked to him. Being not the smartest tool in the box Einstein didn't figure out that she was in love with him. (Or more specifically his added weight.) Strangely nowhere on the walk home did Einstein ever notice how his big dangling stomach was swaying as he was running. Not even when it almost made him tumble over when he took a curve very sharp. All he could think about was the worries of his friends wondering where he had been. "I can only hope they don't get to know about Cindy." He thought as he was heading to the houseboat.

Does his friend notice that he had been gone when he got back?
11532111.title: The Grand Dane of Beef.

115321112.content:
As Einstein finally arrived to the boat house he found himself being much more tired after running then before. (Still not getting it was from the huge belly he had gained from all the eating.) As he carefully walked down to under deck where they all sleep Einstein felt even more worried about it, thinking that the first thing they would all do would be to ask him where he had been.

Entering the room Einstein looked around prepared to have everyone down his throat asking where he had been all day, but to his surprise nothing happened. Looking around he could see everything looking like it was on a normal day. Francis and Tito was bickering as usal about simple things like what channel on the tv to watch. Rita was trying to sleep despite the loud arguing happening almost next to her, and Dodgers was just chilling in a new pair of sunglasses that he had stolen from a stand on the streets.

Felling a bit to scared to speak at first Einstein then took curage to say, "I'm pretty sure you all been wondering where I have been..." Before being cut of by Tito and Francis. "Give me the remote, I want to watch wrestling!" "Such brainless nonsense? Never, as long as I would say." "And what would you rather watch? One of those boring old plays where everybody speaks like no one has for the past hundred years?" "Huh! They speak the way all people who has a little bit of intellect would speak. It's not my problem that you don't know about the diplomatic way to solve an issue." "If one of those guys just took out his sword and chopped the other ones head of things could be solved quicker!" "Yes. If you want to solve all your problems like you where a caveman then fine, but at least do it somewhere else." "Fine, I will!" Tito said and walked away, only to stop after a few moments. "HEY! You're trickering me to walk away so you can have the tv for yourself!" "And I see that it worked." This made Tito soo angry that he started to attack Francis, who wasn't late to reply. At this point none of them said anything that sounded like words, they where just two angry dogs fighting. "What I was about to say was..." Einstein tried to say again before getting cut off by Rita this time.

"Can't you two just shut up!? Some of us are trying to get some sleep!" Rita yelled at them. "Well excuse us for not staying up all night like someone else." Tito said back. "I have you know that I do night shifts as well. That meant that I offer some of my night sleep to look for food or valuables or anything else that can help our situation! So don't you dare tell me that I do nothing important while you all are asleep, as I give more to this team every day then you two could do in a week together!" "As if." Tito said unimpressed.

Rita was on her way to get up and tear that stuck up little dog apart, and Einstein prepared to go in between when the cool sterling voice of Dodger kicked in. "Rita darling, keep your cool. Don't let yourself sink down to their levels." Taking Dodgers advice Rita took and laid down again, while Dodger still sat down with his back turned to everybody. "And you two, why do you have to do such a fight over this? Don't you remeber the rules Francis?" "Yes I do." Francis answered in a low voice, knowing what to come. "And what does the rules say?" That on uneven days I get to pick the program to watch and on even days TIto gets to choose." And what day is it today?" Dodger asked, knowing too the answer to come. "The...tenth." Francis said after much resistance. "So what does that mean?" Dodger asked cooly again. "That Tito is the one who gets to choose." Francis said defeated. "Then give Tito the remote." Dodger said whichs Francis then did, which lead to Tito changing the channel back to wrestling. "Still thinks it's a poor excuse to show grafical violence." Francis muttered. "To bad I'm the one with the remote now." Tito said and continued watching.

Seeing how during all of this nobody had notiched him EInstein decided to go back to his sleeping place to rest. He put on a blanket over him for comfort, that also conveniently hide his swollen middle. It wasn't until Fagin came back home that the gang started to notice that Einstein also was present, but they still thought that he had been with them the whole day. When it was time for them all to have dinner Einstein still felt like he wasn't hungry and passed. It was also good since then he didn't need to get up and reveal his still hanging gut for everyone.

When the night was coming and all the other dogs and Fagin was asleep Einstein was the only one to be awake thinking about what to do the next day. He remembers the promise he and Cindy made about meeting again, but he wondered if she would have mined him bringing his friends with him? She had a lot of food to spare and his friends all looked like they could use some of it, but ever since coming back he realized that they didn't seem to notice any difference in their lifes if he was gone a whole day. "Maybe they don't deserve it?" Einstein thought.

What should he do the next day?

He gets taken to become a test animal.

115332.content: How about making a whole new character to use in this story?
115332.title: New characters

1153321.content:
How about Princilla, a young poodle girl who is the result of Georgette and Tito living together.

After Georgette got pregnant she gave birth to a healthy bunch of 8 puppies. Jenny and her family later took and sold all of them but one, which happen to be Princilla.

Her name was of course given by her mother, who was very determined to stick to her choice of name. Her poor husband had to find himself being beaten because his wife was about three times his size.

She a poodle like her mother and has the same white skin like her, but her fur is more brown like her father. Her hairstyle is also different, being much more shorter cut and put up with hairgel.

She is very interested in exploring the world, and unlike her mother she isn't afraid to get her paws dirty in the process. Her mother dosen't really approve her little explorings, afraid of the dangers that could hurt her, and would rather want her daughter to become a prize vinning beuty like her mother. Her father Tito on the other hand dosen't really have any opinion on it because both his daughter and wife always wants him to be on their side during discussions, he's afraid of his daughter getting herself into troubles to big for her to handle, and he often finds himself being i need to save his daugther from the worst dangers she puts herself into.

Would you like for the story to be about Princilla?
1153321.title: Princilla.

11533211.content: In which kind of age would Princilla be in where this story takes place?
11533211.title: What age?

11533212.content:
How about this one?

(This takes place after the movie in a version where Tito stays living with Georgette.)

His name is Enrico and he's a friend to Tito and a fellow chihuahua. He looks a bit like Tito, except for his fur is in a bit of a darker shade, and he has a small scar over one cheek after a fight with a bigger dog. Just like Tito he's a small fighter who likes to put himself against impossible odds, but unlike Tito he didn't have that bit of friendliness that Tito had, and had becuase of that live a much more lonely life of survival. He even left New Work to test his luck in Beverly Hills instead.

1153321222121.content:
It was a beautiful day and Oliver and Georgette was being walked through central park with Jenny when Oliver saw something strange.

It was a dog that was runnig down the streets of New Work, completely ignoring the traffic. Cars was stopping and honking at him as he run along before he dissapeared into an alley. Oliver didn't know at first what was wrong with this dog. It wasn't a very tall dog, he looked to be about just a few inches taller then a full grown cat. But there was something else about his looks. Oliver had seen that he had a collar with a tag that looked like a lighting bolt, and he had also seen the same symbol on the dogs fur. Thinking back Oliver remembers looking at pictures of strange people dressed in suits with symbols like that in comics that Jenny read. She had said to him that those people was "heroes", whose job was to safe the world from evil bad guys. "Then this dog must be one of those hero types!" Oliver figured out.

Without saying a word to neither Georgette or Jenny, Oliver took off and started to run into the alley after the dog. Once there he looked around and saw some white fur sticking out from under some rags. He approached it carefully as if to not startle him, but as soon as he touched his body with his paw the dog quickly jumped up from the trash and looked like he was going to attack. "Who are you and who are you working for?!" The dog asked threatening. "Working for?" Oliver asked confused and scared. "Yes, Who send you to take care of me?!" The dog asked back. "A-All I wanted to do was to h-help you." Oliver said super afraid that the dog would end him any second now, but instead the dog became more confused by this. "Help me? Why would I need help?" He asked. "Because you looked a bit lost, and maybe needed someone to guide you?" Oliver answered carefully. The dog took a moment to look at his surroundings while saying, "I have to admit I might need some directions."

Taking a lot of courage Oliver said, "My name is Oliver. What's yours?" "The name is Bolt." The dog said. "Oh, Just like the thing on you're collar and body." Oliver said. "Yes. The very symbol of me." Bolt said proud. "Are you a hero mister Bolt?" Oliver asked. "Yes. Yes I am kid." Bolt answers. "I'm a dog with the greatest power in existence. Powers soo strong that a single bark from me has the power to destroy this whole city." "Wow!" Oliver said amazed. "I'm currently on a mission to save my owner Penny from the evil clutches of Doctor Calico, my arch nemesis, but I have no idea where I am, or where she is..." Bolt said before his stomach interrupted him. "And I haven't been eating for a while." He said a bit embarassed.

Oliver didn't know what to do first. This dog was acting a bit strange and he had been a bit agressive to him at first, but he both looked, talked, and acted just like a hero from one of those comicbooks would act, and if what he said was true then Oliver needed to anything he could to help him. And the best way to do soo right now seems to be to help him get food.

What happens next?
1153321222121.title: A hero in real life.

11533212221211.content:
Oliver felt unsure on what he was going to do, and it wasn't until he heard the voice of Jenny calling him that he decided to help this strange dog. He quickly gave him the street address to Jenny's home, and then he went back to join Jenny and Georgette. As they all three walked back home Oliver could see the dog called "Bolt" leave the alley and run of in the opposite direction. "I wonder if I will see that mysterious dog again?" Oliver thought to himself.

Back at home things went on as usual, but later on the evening things would be a bit different. Oliver woke up during the night and felt he needed to have a midnight snack. When he got to the kitchen he heard the sound of something hitting the window. Looking out he saw that it was that strange dog from before standing outside throwing pebbles at the window. "Bolt!" Oliver said happily surprised.

He took and open the window, and to his surprise saw that despite the dog looking very hungry and weak still managed to take a huge leap and reach up to the kitchen window. Once inside Bolt took a moment to really take in the new environment he was in. It was really big and warm, not exactly the kind of home he would have expected a simple cat to live in. Suddenly he heard a very familiar sound coming from him. It was his stomach, still hungry for food.

"Do you need anything to eat?" Oliver asked him when he too heard Bolt's stomach make it's sound. But before the dog had any chance to answer they both heard the sound of someone upstairs making their way down the stairs.

Who is it?
