11533212222222222.content:
The story will feature a fat female Chihuahua named Whitney Awa Henriksen. (But she like to call herself Wa-Wa for short) She's working as a stand up comedian, and she will become Tito's love interest in the story. (While Tito is still together with Georgette, creating a love triangle)

Back story: She was born and raised in New York city, She was fat already as a pup, and got bullied a lot by other pups because of that. All the mean things they said only made her want to stay inside and eat more, which only lead to more bulling, which only lead to more eating...

When she was feeling at most sad her mother decided to take her to see a comedy show to try and make her happy. In this show was a dog that had only three legs (He lost one in a traffic accident) , and made jokes about that. He made all kinds of jokes like "In racers I'm only worth three quarters of the bets!" or "I'll give my right hind leg for that.". Wa-Wa laughed at his jokes but felt bad at the same time laughing at his missing one limb. But she saw how other dogs laughed at him, and how he just took it into him as something good that made her feel comfortable laughing as well.

After the show she asked her mother if she could get back staged and talk to the limped dog, and she said yes. Once she meet him she told him that being laughed at herself for her weight she could never think about laughing at him at first, feeling it would be a really mean thing to do. He told her that he too had been in the same situation as her, being made fun of for being the only one three legged had made him feel bad too, but once he realized he could take their "bad" laughter and turn it into "good" laughter he thought he could use his disadvantage to his own advantage. He asked her to tell him a joke about her weight, and even thought her mother thought it was very rude of him to force her daughter into doing something like that she decided to do it, and gave him her best try. After telling a joke that she just managed to make up on the spot the three legged dog was quiet for a moment, and then bursted out laughing out loud at it. Feeling how his laugher worked as adrenaline to her she immediately gave him another joke, and then another one, and then another one.

It didn't take long for other comedy act sitting next to them to also get involved in the act, and once they heard one joke from her they too where laughing uncontrollably. Even her own mother found her funny side after a while and was just so happy to see her daughter being happy herself. Once she finally felt that she run out of jokes to tell the three legged dog told her that she had great potential to become a great name in the business, and that she could always use comedy as a way to make her feel better about herself.

And since then she has been a hardworking stand up comedian that shows that no matter what others thinks about your looks, you yourself is the one that makes the final choice.

She has a very joke filled attitude. Both on stage and in private she like to pull prank and tell jokes. (Often using her own fatness as a source.) She also is a very "down to earth" dog, not being as full of herself like other famous dogs. (Like Georgette.)

(Just so you know she can go on a diet and loose her weight if she wants, but she wont. No only because it would take away a big part of her act, but she herself has also been living her whole life like this, and she also likes it very much. Her fat is part of her both symbolically and physically.)

(Inspiration for her is a sketched picture on furaffinity by the user Dutch. http://www.furaffinity.net/view/6306952/... )

Would you like the story to be about her?
11533212222222222.title: Wa-Wa.

115332122222222221.content:
Ever since getting together Tito and Georgette had been trying new things to do together to try and find a common interest, but they turned out to be VERY different. While Georgette liked things like fashion show, modelling, and romantic movies Tito preferred wrestling, gambling, and action films. They had both tried to convince the other one to test the others interest, but no one would want to chance. The whole situation seemed to be unsolvable, until Georgette got the idea of trying something that none of them had ever tried before and see if that would bring them closer together. The only thing now was to figure out what they should try. It wasn't until Georgette saw an ad in the newspaper about a "Dog Special: Stand Up Night." None of them had ever been at a stand up club evening before so it would be a unique experience for both of them. They both very quickly decided that this would be great, and made it an evening.

Later at the club Georgette and Tito both had no idea of just how fun this would turned out to be. All night they had been seeing many funny dogs doing their stand up routines, all from a very tall Great Dane male talking about how strange it is being friends with dogs that was so much smaller as full grown adults then he had been as a pup, to a female Saluki telling about the day when she realized just how ridiculously similar lifestyles both her and her owner had, to a male poodle talking about how hard it was being a male and having everyone he met believing that he either was a female or a very "feminine" male. After he was done a Dalmatian male came out on stage (that was the organizer of the show), and told everyone that there was one "special" guest left. "And now ladies and gentledogs it's time for me to present one of the literally biggest names of show business. Yes, even bigger then Big George. (The Great Dane from earlier) Give a round of applauds to Whitney Awa Henriksen."

As everybody gave a big applaud for her as she entered the stage some of them stopped applauding in shock when they saw her. They weren't lying when they said she was "one of the biggest names" in standup comedy. She was a Chihuahua female that was at least eight times the dog when it comes to weight. As she waddled in everyone could see how her entire body was shaking with every step. How her swollen cheeks and extra chins made her face much more "filling". Her chest was puffing out with a great distance and so was her stomach. And even though they couldn't see her from behind they still knew that she must have one wide read end. The only parts of her that looked kinda non-fat was her legs (that still was a bit more meaty then on normal dogs of her breed), and her tail that looked ridiculously small compared to the rest of her. As for her choice of being dressed for the evening she had a small English bowler hat (She used it as a part of her famous impersonation of an English bulldog. She was good at doing both a British accent and a male voice, and she of course had the right physics to make it complete.), and a collar with rubber bone attached on it that she used as a funny signal to give after telling one of her jokes. Seeing this colossus of a dog's body shake as she walked was simply disgusting for Georgette, while Tito couldn't stop staring at the beauty of it.

Once she got to the microphone she took a moment to take in the environment before saying, "Good Evening New York City!!!". "Good Evening Wa-Wa!!!" Almost the whole crowd shouted back at her. (Tito and Georgette being the exception of course.) She knew she would get that answer and she loved hearing it every time. "Let me introduce myself. My name is Whitney Awa Henriksen, but I like you to just call me Wa-Wa." The fat Chihuahua said as the start of her routine. "I know what you're thinking now, have someone taken and shrunk the head and legs of a well feed bulldog?" She asked showing of how little her legs where compared to her belly. This tore down another great laughter from the audience. Some of them had seen her tell this joke before so they what would come next, but they still laughed like mad. "Well all I can say to that is..." She said before taking a break to keep the crowd on their seats for the punch line. "As long as me staff keeps feeding me, who am I to complain?" she said in her flawless impersonation of a male British bulldog. For all of those who had seen her before this was classic Wa-Wa stick they where watching, but for someone like Tito who saw it for the first time this was one of the most amazing comedy acts he had ever seen. He just knew he had to go see her afterward and let her know just how much he loved her act. (And maybe more then so.) "I can't believe you find this overstuffed sauces funny." Georgette whispered to Tito, who only replayed "Well, it was your idea to get here in the first place." back to her.

Should we jump to after the show where Tito goes to meet Wa-Wa backstage, or should we watch some more of her routine?
115332122222222221.title: An evening with laughters. (And more)

choices: Had someone else in the room.
1153321222222222211.content:
After watching the show Tito knew he had to met that wonderful Chihuahua, so he decided to go and try to meet her backstage. Knowing that Georgette wasn't so keen about her he decided to go and meet her alone. "You can go home before me dear, I am just going to...see if they have something nice in the gift shop for me to buy." Tito made up as an excuse to Georgette, who seemed to believe it. "Okay, see you back at home." She said before leaving. "That was almost to easy." Tito thought, thinking that Georgette would have seen through his badly acted lie.

Once at the entrance to the changing rooms Tito saw a big Doberman guarding the door. Even though he was getting a bit afraid getting close to him, (Still having bad memories of Roscoe and Desoto.) he took courage and walked up to him. The Doberman looked down at him and Tito carefully asked if it was possible to meet and greet "Miss seniorrita Wa-Wa" as Tito called her. The Doberman told him that almost no one of the dogs performing here likes to get disturbed by fans, "But lucky for you miss Wa-Wa happens to be one of those few who is most glad to meet anyone that she has been helping making their lives a bit more happier." The Doberman finished and let Tito pass. "Her dressing room is the one on the right at the very end of the corridor." He said before closing the door behind Tito.

As Tito walked through the small hallway he could see some doors being slightly open, and inside he could see some of the other dogs that had preformed resting inside. Some of them where reading some book or newspaper, some where eating or drinking, and some where just taking a quick sleep. He took small glances on many of them, but made sure to not stare for to long since they would notice and be upset. His goal was to get to the last door on the right at the end of corridor and nothing else. His plan was that once he got there he wa going to tell her how much he enjoyed her act, and then maybe ask her if she wanted to come over for dinner back at his and Georgette's place.

Once there he saw that unlike many of the other acts she seemed to prefer to have her door completely closed. This made Tito a bit more nervous since now he would have to knock on her door to get her attention. After some moments of courage building he took and knocked on her door. From inside he heard her say "Who is it?" in a very calm and kind voice. Hearing this Tito got a bit more calm and safely said "It's a fan that would very much like to meet you." "Oh, then just come in and close the door after you." Wa-Wa answered very quickly. Almost not believing this was for real Tito took and open the door to her dressing room and walked in.

Once inside Tito saw that Wa-Wa...
1153321222222222211.title: Meeting a "huge" star.

choices: Tito asks her about the dinner.
He gets to shy to talk anymore.
11533212222222222111.content:
"Close the door if you please." He heard Wa-Wa say, and he did so immediately. Turning back to her after doing so Tito found himself staring right into the huge butt of Wa-Wa. She was having a very small changing room, and given her big size that didn't make things better. Trying to look over her big behind Tito could see her face in the reflection of the mirror in the room. "If you want me to wait outside until you're done I can do that." Tito said while standing on his hind legs to be able to see her in the eyes while talking. "No you can stay." Wa-Wa answered casually back. "But..." Tito said while having his eyes quickly go back to the butt of Wa-Wa, "Wouldn't it be better to be able to see me in the eyes when we talk?" He managed to get out, while slightly distracted. "It's okay. I'm soon done getting dressed." He heard Wa-Wa say. "Oh okay...Wait, you are naked?!" Tito asked shocked, as he lost his balance and fell down onto the floor. "I'm without my collar on me so yeah, I guess so." Wa-Wa said still as casual as ever. Tito felt a bit strange inside. He knew dogs where pretty much naked all the time, but they all had some kind of accessories on themselves. Some had collars or scarf's like Georgette or Dodgers, or a headband like him. Knowing that this lady wasn't wearing anything and staring at her butt once again made Tito feel a bit more awkward of staring (And a bit turned on.) "Um," He said while doing his balance act once again, "Are you really sure you don't want me to wait outside?" "You can stay where you are." Wa-Wa said. "And you," She said looking him straight in the eyes via the mirror. " Yes?" Tito asked curious. "You don't look to comfortable standing like that, don't you?" She asked. "No I don't." Tito answered, trying to sound as normal as he could. "Why don't you take and stand normally while you talk to me?" She asks. "Well...I..." Tito tried to give a honest answer, but he didn't want to make it sound like he was a pervert. "It's just that...you wont probably be able to hear me if I don't stand up on my hind legs." He finally managed to say. "I could hear you when you where outside of my dressing room, and you could hear me." She said, making Tito's argument invalid. Knowing he didn't have any other reason to give why he didn't want to speak this way with her Tito accepted defeat, and got down on.

"Was it something else you wanted?" Wa-Wa asked. "Well, I came here both to say that I really liked your stand up show." Tito said, starting to sound very casual in his tone as well now. "Oh how sweet of you." He heard Wa-Wa say. "And I also got over here to ask you if you wanted too..." Tito stopped when he saw that Wa-Wa's huge rear was starting to shake from side to side a little. Still being so close to it Tito had even more trouble ignoring it now. "Uhm, do you have any troubles back there?" Tito asked, starting to get a bit scared that she was going to start move her big bottom right into him. "Oh that, I'm just trying too fit my collar around my neck, and that's not so easy." She said in-between shakes. "If you want to I could help you put it on." Tito said, trying his best to break the hypnosis he felt he was starting to get by watching Wa-Wa's shaking. "I've done it hundreds of times before alone. I think I can fix it. It will just take some time. What was the other thing you wanted to ask about?" She asked curious. "Oh that, uhm." Tito tried to find words but Wa-Wa's butt looked like it was shaking a bit more then before. "I just wanted to tell you that since you where so great at stage and I really liked you I thought that maybe you would be interested in getting something more for your hard work, something more then just you're regular salary. Not that it is something wrong with what you earn, I think you must be getting paid a lot for it, being so good at doing comedy like you do and..." Okay Tito was convinced now. Her well round rump was shaking much, much more then before! Even it's rhythms seemed to be moving in a much more seductive way then before. "AND I would very much like that someone like you should be given something more then the ordinary, since you are so gifted and talented and good and...ARE YOU SURE YOU DON'T NEED ANY HELP WITH YOUR COLLAR??!!!" Tito shouted, finally finding it impossible to ignore Wa-Wa's butt shaking as a result of her struggling to get her collar on.

As soon as he asked that the butt shaking suddenly stopped and Wa-Wa turned her entire body around to show Tito her collar sitting around her neck. "I got it on a looooong time ago." Wa-Wa said and laughed at her own prank. Tito felt really embarrassed over being tricked like that, and by the fact that Wa-Wa had known he had been staring this whole time. "Was it something that kept you distracted from just talking normally to me?" She asked and made motions that made her behind parts shake again. "Maybe some things." Tito managed to say with blushed checks.

What happens next?
11533212222222222111.title: Not wanting to stare, butt...

choices: Jump to next Friday at Tito and Georgette's house.
Suddenly Georgette appears in the dressing room.
115332122222222221111.content:
"But lets get back to the topic. What was it you wanted to ask me?" Wa-Wa asked, sounding a bit more serious this time. "What I wanted to ask you was if you wanted to come over to my place for dinner one night?" Tito said in the kind of serious and straight on way he had wished to say from the start. "Oh." Wa-Wa said, in a bit of a sad way. "Listen. you are really sweet Tito, but I just can't go home to complete stranger and have dinner. It's not a very safe thing to do." "I understand." Tito said, feeling very disappointed. "I think I should go." He said and turned his back to walk out. "I think Georgette might be waiting for me at home."

"Wait!" He heard Wa-Wa shout from behind him. "Yes, what is it?" Tito asked confused. "Are you telling me that you are together with Georgette. The Georgette?" Wa-Wa asked sounding very excited. "Uhm yeah. Why do you ask that..." Tito managed to say before getting attacked by Wa-Wa's screams of joy. "Oh my god! Oh my god! You have no idea but I LOVE to read about gossips, and one of my favourite dogs to read about is Georgette the modelling poodle. There is always so many wonderful scandals about everything she says and does that you could make whole newspapers just about her." She said while being so excited that she managed to make her fat jump several times, making the ground Tito stood on shake. She was acting a lot like his bellowed Georgette when she was shopping for new clothes. "I remember reading about her getting together with some troublemaker living on the streets, but I could never guess it was you." She said getting really close face to face. "Well, since getting together I live the high life so I don't need to work hard to get some riches." Tito said as an awkward way to give her an answer. "We where both sitting here and watched your show Wa-Wa." Tito said. "And I didn't see you. Just my luck." Wa-Wa said feeling like she missed her only chance at seeing her favourite celebrity. "You know, I still got that dinner for you if you want to." Tito told her again, this time feeling more sure she would take it.

And he was right in believing so since Wa-Wa gave him several quick "Yes" to make sure he did understand. "I wouldn't want to do anything else then to see with my own eyes how a typical evening in Georgette's crazy life is." "Then should next Friday sound like a good day to come." Tito asked. "Yes, I think so." Wa-Wa answered after some thought. "And I guess I won't have to tell you where we live?" Tito asked feeling he would already know the answer. "I have been reading enough magazines to know just everyway there is to go there." Wa-Wa said. "In that case I guess I leave now and we all three see each other next Friday." Tito said and started to leave when...
115332122222222221111.title: The idol of an idol.

1153321222222222211111.content:
After making up the plans for the dinner with Wa-Wa Tito thought there would be no problems telling his wife about it, turns out it wasn't that easy.

He was trying to put it up nicely to make it easier when he got to the point of it, but every time he even mentions the club or "stand up" in general all Georgette would say was how much she hated that "Pig disguised as a dog". So Tito always took and decided to wait later to tell her. "Not a smart idea to anger the beast." Tito thought to himself.

Finally the day had arrived and Tito had still not managed to tell Georgette about the "guest" they would be having tonight. All he had managed to tell her was that he wanted the dinner for tonight to be "extra nice", and when Georgette asked him why he was so interested in just tonight's dinner he only managed to say "Just to have a romantic evening together".

It wasn't until Georgette was in the middle of making the dinner that Tito finally took courage to tell her the truth, but even then he took it gently. "Uhm, sweetie?" He said almost whispering to her. "Yes dear?" She answered calmly while cooking the food. "There is something I have been trying to tell you a long time without being able to do so before." Tito said while keeping his eyes down from Georgette for fear of what to come. "And what would that be?" Georgette asked, turning her head to look down at Tito while still cooking. "We might have a guest for dinner tonight." He said almost wanting to leave after saying it. This made Georgette actually stop with what she was doing and turn around to look her husband in the eyes. "What?" She asked sounding really upset, and with good reasons. "I invited another dog to eat with us." Tito said, once again not daring to say it was Wa-Wa he was talking about. He expected Georgette to freak out and get furious over it, but instead all she could say was. "And how do you expect that this food I am making for us is suppose to feed three?" Tito being surprised over that that was her biggest concern simply answered. "Well, you always make food with the intention for two dogs your size. And since I'm barley able to eat half a portion of my dish, and you always thinking about your figure it is at least another whole portion that becomes leftovers each time." He felt really smart for thinking that out on the spot (Not counting on the fact that someone like Wa-Wa possibly could eat two Georgette sized meals as her own dinner) , and Georgette seems to buy it. "Alright." She said after a moment of thinking, "I guess we can have one of you friends over for tonight without any problems, but next time you should tell me earlier." She said before getting back to the cooking.

Tito felt really relieved of that everything seemed to be solved. So much so that it wasn't until there was a knock on the door that it hit him Who he had been inviting. "Is that the guest already here?" Georgette asked. "I think so." Tito said nervously. "I'm nowhere near done, why is this guest so early?" Georgette asked, a bit frustrated over her husband putting up the pressure on her. "I must have forgot to tell her the time." Tito said, before realizing what word he had just said next to Georgette. "She?" He heard her say with that familiar tone of suspecting her husband cheating on her, like she always did when he had been hanging with some unknown female dog. "Yes. She's a she." Tito said with confidence. "She's a friend and nothing more. I could never find anyone that could possible replace you my majestic flower." He told her, while thinking (Although that Wa-Wa is pretty close second.). "So what should you suggest we do now with the food no where near done yet?" Georgette asked, wanting to see if her husband already had some plan thought out for it. "I can just show her around the house while you finish it up. Giving how much wonderful prizes of you there is to show it might take much more time then necessary to let you have time to put it up nicely on the table." Tito said, knowing that talking about Georgette's all prizes always made her think about her greatness. "I guess that could be a good way to spend some time." Georgette said while thinking about it for a small moment. "Alright, let her in while I stay here." She finally said. "Aye, Aye darling." Tito said and went off to let Wa-Wa in.

On the other side of the door was Wa-Wa, looking as pretty as always to Tito. She wasn't wearing her boulder hat like she did at the club, and instead of her "joke" collar she was now wearing a beautifully golden collar with a small diamond hanging in front of it. Wa-Wa could see that Tito was totally mesmerised by the sight of her and she asked jokingly, "What do you think?" "I think you look as pretty as a new blossomed flower." Tito said not braking his stare. "Oh, fancy words for me? Is there a hint of love I see?" Wa-Wa asked playfully, and Tito immediately broke from his trance to say, "What? No, no, no. That's crazy. I can't be in love since I already have a wife. He, he." He said, pretending to laugh at the thought about him loving her. (Even thought he knew inside that he had been feeling just that ever since he first saw her.)

Wanting to change the subject Tito asked if she wanted to come inside, which she said yes to with no doubt. Once inside Tito told her that Georgette was to busy working up the food to see her right now so he thought it would be better if they both took and wondered around the house during the time it would take. Wa-Wa was really excited over it. She had been reading so many articles about how it looks inside Georgette's house, but seeing it herself was something new. Every things in every room was like a holy museum artefact to her, and to meet Georgette herself would be the great final to everything. "Oh, I can't wait to meet Georgette in person. When I see I think I will flip out!" She said excited to Tito. "Not as much as she probably will." Tito said quietly to himself, dreading the moment when they had to meet.

After walking around the whole house Wa-Wa felt she needed to rest her tired legs. Tito quickly lead her to a big bean bag laying in the living room., where she quickly laid herself down on her back. "Was it the stairs that was to hard to walk or what was it?" Tito asked worried, as he laid himself next to her. "No, it's not that." Wa-Wa said, "When you have a body like of course you will get tired easily. On the way here I had to rest at least three times before I got here." "Don't you think that you should maybe...lose some weight?" Tito asked after having a slight pause, fearing he had been stepping on a nerve on her there. "Some times yes." Wa-Wa answered calmly. "But there is so many times when I can do good and funny things with my body, that I can't help but loving it soo much. Do you remember when I had trouble putting my collar on?" She asked, and could see on Tito blushing that he did remember it very well. "When I get older I might have to do it to be able to move around better, but as long as I can still move will never get rid of a single pound!" She said proud. Tito could do nothing more then agree on what she was saying. "If you can't even love your own body, then who can you love?" He thought to himself.

Suddenly they both heard the sound of the kitchen timer going of meaning that the food was finished, and that Georgette would soon make her entrance to the room. Tito thought franticly over what he should do or say that would be best for the situation, but he couldn't think out anything that would work on Georgette when she was in her anger mood. All he could do was to wait for the inevitable to happen. Just as he heard Georgette was on her way Tito decided to get up from the bean bag, if anything he thought that having Georgette see him laying next to the dog she hated so much wouldn't be the best way to start of with.

When Georgette finally came through the door Tito was quick to try and make her look only at him as he tried his best to explain why she was there, and why he thought it was a good idea to invite her. But trying to hide the dog eight times his size from the dog that was having her head two feet higher up then he could reach was just as impossible as you could guess. He could see in her eyes that she was filled with disgust and annoyance over seeing that dog again, and also the fact that she was inside her own home gave her also a personal anger to it. She didn't say anything, and when Tito tried to speak to her all she said was. "You and me. The kitchen. NOW!"

Not daring to speak against her now he and Georgette had to continue to have their talk inside the kitchen with closed doors, while Wa-Wa had to keep waiting on the bean bag. Once alone Georgette wasted no time by immediately ask Tito "What do you mean by inviting HER into our house?!" very angrily. "Well..." Tito started carefully, "You said to me earlier that it was okay for me to invite a friend for dinner." "But that was before I knew that the friend you where talking about was that sack of lard that is now laying on my bean sack." Georgette said, trying her hardest to find new things to call her. "Hey! She's a very hard working entertainer! She has a very tight schedule to work with, and when I asked her if she wanted an evening with dinner at our place I didn't think she would have time, but she looked past a lot of things just find a day when she could get here. She has made a long trip to get here and if you still want her to go you will have to tell, cause I wont!" Tito barked back, tired of hearing his wife say all these mean things to her. Georgette stared at her little man for a while (Being a bit impressed over how loud he could make his voice some times.), before saying....
1153321222222222211111.title: One more for dinner.

11533212222222222111111.content:
"You really want her to have this dinner?" Georgette asked calmly, waiting to say what she thinks until Tito had answered. "More then anything else. She needs a break for her hectic lifestyle." Tito answered, without any hesitation. "Well then." Georgette said and turned away. "I will let your friend have dinner together with us if it means so much for you and her." Tito was very surprised over hearing Georgette actually giving in to it. "While I take and serve up the food, could you go and tell he that its time to eat?" She asked in a much more nicer tone compared to just a couple of seconds ago. "I will." Tito said and started walking back to the living room where Wa-Wa was waiting. But before he left he looked back at Georgette and said. "And darling?" "Yes dear?" Georgette asked, sounding a bit annoyed thinking that Tito still wanted her to do something more for that strange dog. "I'm sorry that I yell at you. I just want to try and help a friend in need when I can." Tito said sounding a bit regretful over how he had been acting. "I think I may have been judging a bit to hard as well." Georgette said and looked at her husband for comfort. "I love you darling." Tito said. "I love you to dear." Georgette said.

As Tito leaved the kitchen and came back to the living room he could feel how difficult things became. He had just said to Georgette that he loved her, but seeing Wa-Wa again laying with her cute belly up made Tito feel so heart-full inside again. Was it truly Georgette that he loved, or did his heart lay in charming and funny Wa-Wa?

No matter what he knew that what was important now was the dinner, and that's what he would be focusing on right now. "The dinner is served now." He tried to told her, in the most "normal" sounding voice he could. "Are you working as the staff at this place now or what?" Wa-Wa jokingly said while getting off the bean bag. Tito once again had to admirer that girl's way of always finding something funny to say in almost every situation.

As they both entered the kitchen they saw that Georgette had been preparing a nice meal for all of them. She had been cooking some nice juicy pieces of chicken breasts that was being served with some mashed potatoes, some roasted bits of unions, and a slightly spiced salsa sauce. She had originally planned on serving two pieces of chicken to herself and Tito, but since he told her about him inviting a third dog she had changed it to her still having two while the other two each had a single chicken breast. Since she was much bigger then the two other Georgette thought it would be enough for them all, but knowing now that it was Wa-Wa Tito had invited she didn't felt so sure anymore. Wa-Wa noticed that it also was some lighted candles and rose petals spread all over the table. "Where you planning on something romantic?" Wa-Wa asked, while seeing how Tito was getting a little ashamed of her asking. "Yes. Tito wanted me to make tonight dinner a bit special, but that was before he had told me that the something special was you." Georgette said, and tried to not sound a even a little bit upset over her husband not telling about Wa-Wa coming here until she was standing cooking the dinner for them.

They decided to get to their sets, and while Georgette had no problems getting on her chair Tito had to jump up because of his small size, and then there was Wa-Wa. Seeing her standing next to the big chair with her small fat body Tito realized very quickly that she wouldn't be able to jump up like he did, so he leaned over to Georgette and whispered "Miss Wa-Wa seems to have trouble getting up." "And what do you suggest I will do about it?" Georgette asked, not understanding where he was going with it. "Maybe you should help her get up?" Tito asked back, sounding a bit more serious his tone. "Why me?" Georgette said, sounding really surprised that she should do it. "She is your friend, so why don't you do it?" She asked back to him. "Because of her "uh hum" size, I wouldn't be able to lift her with my small body. And since you are so much bigger and stronger then me, I'm begging you to do it." Tito said, sounding really concern this time. "Fine." Georgette said after a moment of thinking and got off her chair to help Wa-Wa up, and since she couldn't keep herself balanced while picking her up with her paws Georgette would have to use her head instead. Sighing she walked over to Wa-Wa and told her that she would help her get up, and before she knew it she found her face pressed deep into the fat butt of Wa-Wa, as she was pressing her up towards her seat. Remembering the event that took place at the changing room Tito felt a bit jealous on his wife getting to experience this. After what felt like an hour long of smelly torture Wa-Wa was able to get up on her chair, and Georgette could go back to her seat.

Finally starting the dinner all three of them started enjoying the food Georgette had been taking the time to make. They all had different ways of eating. Georgette was as predicted very keen on her manners and actually used the forks and knife a bit like humans do to make everything she sticks in her mouth just large enough, without making a mess of things. Something that her husband used to do when he was a single guy, but ever since meeting Georgette his manners had started to change a little. He was still eating with his paws and was digging his head down to eat, but he tried much more to not make a mess out of things when he eat, and he also took some breaks in-between mouthfuls to really feel the taste of things. The one that was actually eating must like a dog was Wa-Wa, who was just pressing her face into the plate all-time and eating like she was a pig. Still nothing of what she ate ended up outside the plate or on the table, much to Georgette and Tito's surprise. She loved Georgette's cooking so much that she made sure nothing got wasted, and once she was done with the plate she still had two mouthfuls of food all over her face, which she just licked off.

After eating they all three just sat there and let the food rest inside of them. Mostly Wa-Wa, who's belly stood out even more then usual (If that even was possible). While Georgette and Tito had both had a portion that suited their body size's Wa-Wa had been having a Georgette sized portion instead, making her much more full inside then the other two. "I'll have to say not only is your husband a nice guy for thanking me for my show, but that he invites me to your home as well." Wa-Wa said while rubbing her stomach. "Sounds like you are a big fan of my husband." Georgette said, having those nasty jealous feeling coming back, scaring Tito that things may end up ugly. That is until Wa-Wa (Not noticing Georgette's jealousness) says, "What? No, I'm a huge fan of you." "Wait what?" Georgette said, not at all expecting her to say that. "You are a fan, of me?" "Yes absolute. I love following everything the headlines says about you, and all the articles that gets published." Wa-Wa continued talking, making Georgette much more calmer and liking her more and more. "In fact I wouldn't even be here if it wasn't for your husband telling me that he was together with you." She finished, having Georgette feeling great regret for everything she had said and thought about her before. "But of course, you should be here. I mean why wouldn't someone that has such great taste in dogs not be." Georgette said, sounding very into herself as usual. While starting to ramble about how great she is Wa-Wa leaned over to Tito and whispered. "I had a feeling before that she didn't like me, but I know that if I just stroke her ego a little she would start becoming a fan of me as well."

After the dinner everyone seemed to be in a much more nicer mood then when it started, and when Wa-Wa was about to go Georgette said "If you ever want to come back just ask." "I will." Wa-Wa said and started heading to the door. Tito was quick to get over there to greet her farewell, and before leaving Wa-Wa looked over to see that Georgette wasn't near before whispering "And I think I might like meeting just you sometimes to." into Tito's ear before leaving.

This left Tito standing there, looking over as Wa-Wa's great wide back side turned around a corner and was gone. The words she had said to him was still getting processed trough his brain. "Meeting me alone." Was the only sentence he could make out from it, but should he do it? Should he go out and meet her in secret, or should he tell Georgette about what was going on?
11533212222222222111111.title: Getting to know someone more.

1153321222222222212.content:
"I'm not saying I'm fat, but when other dogs gets to eat their food from a bowl I have to eat from a trough." Wa-Wa said, and squeaked her rubber bone collar like some comedians used a drum beat to hammer in the punch line. Still everybody in the audience loved it all, or rather everyone except for Georgette.

For her this was the lowest excuse for anything called comedy she had ever seen. "A fat disgusting blob telling everyone just ridiculously obese she is. How in the heck is that funny?" Georgette thought to herself angrily. She wanted just to leave, but since her husband Tito was with her she felt that it would be very rude towards him to do. Still she felt that she wouldn't probably be able to take much more of this. She hated just about everything about her. How she looked so stupid wearing her little bowler hat and rubber toy collar, how her fatty body was making her sweat like crazy under the spotlights, "After tonight's performance I think I will have to eat a lot backstage to regain those 5 pounds I must have sweat away performing for you." Wa-Wa said, getting another avalanche of applauses from the crowd. "See! She just admitted herself just how much of a slob she is!" Georgette thought highly, but to herself. "Why can't nobody else see the same things I see?"

"But I'm not so much for keeping myself pretty as you can see. I just think it's a lot of extra work for honestly, very little payoff." Wa-Wa said and pointed towards Georgette and Tito in the crowd. "I mean just look on those two. The lady have probably spent 3 hours on hair and makeup making herself look good for tonight while her partner looks like he just wake up looking like this and decided to go with it." Everyone looked at Georgette and Tito and laughed at Wa-Wa's observation. Tito laughed as well, telling Georgette how true that was, while Georgette felt that this was her last straw. "I can let her do this thing she calls entertainment if there actually is dogs liking this sort of thing, but I'm NOT letting her get away making me look like a fool! And this makeup and hair only took me two hours to put on!"

Georgette was really on the warpath now, and she was not going to quit it until she had told that stand up comedian a thing or two about what she thought of her. "Can't anyone see just how vulgar and disgusting this thing looks?" Georgette asked loudly as she stood up and pointed at Wa-Wa. The whole room got quiet and first looked at Georgette, and then at Wa-Wa to see how she would take it. Wa-Wa was a bit surprised to the poodle she just made fun of talking back to her, but she was very quick to reply, "Yes they can. And if I get a mirror you can see it as well." This got the entire room on track of laughing again, this time over how well Wa-Wa had been taking the bad criticism and turned it back against the one saying it. Georgette felt how she had gone from making them the truth (Her vision), to making her the laughing stock of the place.

"Is that all you wanted to say or do you have something more?" Wa-Wa asked, sounding like she was challenging Georgette now to insult her again. Taking the bait Georgette took and once again gave the worst insult she could give her. "Do you often get compared to a pig?!" She asked aggressively, creating some "Oooooh's" from the audience. Wa-Wa looked even more comfortable this time, answering even faster back to Georgette "Yes, but they always think that's the worst thing they could be compared to." As if Georgette didn't feel angry enough that the chihuahua blimp managed to get another roaring applauses and laughter's she really got mad when the dog on stage said, "I've heard that on almost every day, can't you give me something original?"

"Okay, if you want original. I will give you that!" Georgette thought, and tried her hardest think out another great insult to throw at her. "Tell me if you have heard this before." Georgette shouted to get her attention. (Which she has been having all the time since this started.) "You are insignificant, incompetent, and nobody likes your looks." Georgette said coldly. "No, since I have never met you i don't know what other dogs likes to call you." Wa-Wa answers back quickly once again, sending another wave of her audience support right onto Georgette.

During the applause Wa-Wa started to ignore Georgette's actions by saying, "You know that last one wasn't even a fat joke, so has anyone else better insults they would like to throw at me?" Many in the audience felt unsure, not wanting to say anything bad to her. But Wa-Wa really made it sound fun by saying, "Come on! How many celebrities do you know that gives their audience a chance to make fun of themselves? Take this chance to let you imagination go loose."

Soon there was several dogs throwing fat jokes towards her which she every time manages to send back to the one saying it, making them feel like a moron for saying it in the first place. Georgette didn't know what to do now. She wanted say what she thought to her and make her feel bad, but now several other dogs where doing the same thing as a joke. She wondered if she should just give up and leave.

What does she choose?
1153321222222222212.title: Laugh at or be laughed at.

115332122222222222.content:
This interactive story will introduce a new character named Ace Dalmatian, as he's a world famous sumo wrestling champion like their loving doting father was before he retired from the sport by going out on top.

Ace's backstory: Ace was born and raised in Honolulu Hawaii as he's the son of Randolph a world famous sumo wrestling champion Dalmatian and Mariko an Akita Shiba Inu nurse, as he has three brothers and four sisters as their names are Axel Eddie Tyler Akane Fumiko Haruhi and Kumiko.

What was it that inspired Ace and his brothers to become sumo wrestlers like their father? When Ace and his brothers were little they always watched their father compete as they drew inspiration from their father himself, as their father when he wasn't in the ring competing or when he wasn't busy training himself when there was no sumo tournament going on trained his boys to become sumo wrestlers like him, as their father taught them everything there is about sumo wrestling as he also constantly fattened the boys up much to their mother and sisters own chagrin.

When the boys reached a certain age they enrolled in the sumo wrestling school district as they studied hard and got good grades as they also earned 4 scholarships during their senior year at sumo wrestling high school to attend sumo university as they graduated from sumo wrestling high school at the top of their graduating class, as the boys spent their next 4 years at sumo university as they not only studied hard and got good grades but they also graduated at the top of their graduating class as the boys themselves constantly trained at a sumo stable in their hometown of Honolulu Hawaii, and made their way up the rankings by winning multiple local and state sumo tournaments until it was time for the boys to make their debuts on the national sumo circuit and later on the biggest stage of them all the world sumo stage.

It didn't take all that long for the boys to find success and fame as the boys started winning one sumo wrestling national and then world title after another until the day the boys were promoted to the rank of Yokozuna.

And since then the boys have become legends in the world of sumo wrestling like their father was way back then, as the boys themselves remind everyone that it takes hard work training and pure dedication to the sport of sumo wrestling as you can also follow your dreams and accomplish anything you can set your mind to.

The boys have always approached life with a positive Zen like attitude when they're training themselves at home or when they're traveling the world as they're very down to earth like their family is including their other beloved grandfather Kagemaru who happens to be a very wise and friendly retired sumo wrestler as he's a Shiba Inu dog himself.

Would you like for the story to be about him?

12121.content:
The story so far...

Oliver is an orphan kitten that has to try and survive the streets of New York to live. One day he meet a Jack Russell Terrier called Dodger, who makes a deal with him. If he can help him steal a bunch of hotdogs, he can get some to eat.

After being chased throughout half of New York city by the angry hotdog salesman, Oliver and Dodger managed to find a place to hide from him. The place they choose (Or rather Dodger choose and Oliver followed blindly.) was an old abounded balloon factory.

It was one of those place where Dodger had found out was not taken over by any other dogs, so he called it his personal hideout. This was a place where nobody (not even his own gang) could find him in, and where he could just chill and relax as he felt like.

As he dropped the hotdogs and was preparing himself for a good meal he suddenly heard some panting sounds from behind him. Looking back he saw that it was that little cat from earlier, that seemed to have manage to follow him all the way here. "What are you doing here?" Dodger asked the cat, who answered in between breaths. "You...Promise...We...Share." "Say that again?" Dodger said, wondering if he had heard wrong. "You promise me that you would share those hotdogs with me if I helped you." Oliver said, having catch his breath now so he could talk normally. "Did I promise that?" Dodger asked, just playing with the cat. (Of course he remembers it, he said it just to have the cat help him and then leave it behind. He would never believe that the little fur ball actually would be able to catch up to him.) "Yes! Yes you did!" The cat said, sounding a bit annoyed over the dog tricking him.

"Well I guess I can give you something." Dodger said, making the cat believe that he actually made Dodger cooperate with him. "But..." He said, making Oliver listen. "I want you to close your eyes, and open your mouth wide." "W-Why?" The cat asked slightly nervous. "If you really want to have anything you will have to trust me, or else you can just leave with nothing." Dodger said.

"What do you choose he asked. Oliver knew that he must be planning something fishy, but it did sounded better then leaving with absolutely nothing. So with no more hesitation's Oliver closed his eyes, open his mouth wide, and waited. At first he thought that the dog would just run away and leave him like this, but then he felt something entering his mouth.

When he didn't feel the taste of hotdogs from it he open his eyes and saw that he had shoved in his mouth...

12511.content:
To begin with, Tito was always a small normal sized chihuahua who of course always flirted with Georgette the poodle until one day something happened while he was out and about in New York City.

For Tito had stumbled upon a mysterious looking air pump called the super monster inflator and couldn't help but feel curious about what this item could do.

Tito: Super Monster Inflator? Tito asked himself. Iv'e never heard about or seen this pump until now he said. Well i might as well try it out and see what happens i guess he reluctantly told himself.

And so Tito proceeded to put the attachment onto his nose as he started pushing up and down on the handle as he started balooning to a gigantic size until he was at least 100 ft tall and removed the attachment from his nose as his eyes immediately widened upon looking at his now gigantic body and spoke to himself.

Tito: Holy cow i'm gargantuan, humongous, gigantic, as in big! he said with his now thunderous sounding voice. And since i'm so gigantic sized he boldly said as he heavily starting stomping i'm free to do whatever i want to do he bellowed. But what can a 100 ft tall chihuahua do to have some fun around here? he asked himself. I know he said maybe i oughta pay georgette and the gang a surprise visit or run amok throughout downtown New York City he thought to himself.

13111.content:
Oliver was a bit scared. He had followed Dodger after he and Oliver had stolen some hotdogs. He had followed him to a houseboat at the docks. He took and spied on the insides of the houseboat from a window on the celling. He could see Dodger and the hotdogs, then he saw four more dogs! 3 males and one female. The female one looked to be a Saluki, while the other three was a Bulldog, a Great Dane and a Chihuahua. He thought it whould be best to just stop here and go home again giving that the hotdogs wasn´t going to be worth the risk, but just as he made a quick move to leave he slipt and fell through the open window.

When he landed he hoped that what he was seeing was nothing more then a nightmare. All of the four other dogs where staring and snarling at him. He tried to explane himself but they wouldn´t belive him. "Let´s eat him!" he heard the small little chihuahua say. Even if he was really scared by the thought of being eaten by the dogs he was surprised to hear the threat come from the smallest of the dogs. He was actually bigger then that dog.

But just as it looks like Olive was going to become a dogs dinner Fagin (their owner) came back home. All the dogs forgets Oliver for a moment to say hello to their master. Fagin sees Oliver but dosen´t get how the situation is. "Have you brought a cat in her? You know that we have it hard with enough food given as many as we already are." But then he saw into Oliver eyes with beaging. (Most of being saved from the dogs, but Fagin didn´t knew that.) "I think I have to think about this for a moment" he said while scratching his head. "I think I take some of the dogs for a walk and try to figure out a way on how to solve it."

Which two dogs does Fagin take for walk?
13111.title: At Fagin's houseboat

131111.content:
Today it was Dodger and Rita´s turn to go out for a walk, but before they left Dodger quickly said to the other dogs left that they should not try to do anything to Oliver while they where gone. "I will be back in five minutes" Fagin said before he, Dodger and Rita walked out.

At first nobody on the houseboat said or did anything. They just all was staring at Oliver, and Oliver didn't know what to do. Every time he tried to talk to any of the dogs he just got an angry stare that made him quiet. He was wondering what was going to happen to him when Fagin come back with Dodger and Rita?
Where they going to let him go?
Was he going to live with them?
Or was something terrible going to happen to him?

All of a sudden the chihuahua one snapped. "Why are we doing this!? We have an intruder who is trying to steal our food!" "But Dodger said to wait until he was back." Einstein said. "Yes, and nobody says against Dodgers orders." Francis added. "I don´t care! He´s a cat, He´s our enemy! If there is anything he should be it is our dinner." Tito barked. "Dodger got us some hotdogs for dinner." Francis said. "You can take your hotdogs. I´m going for the cat." Tito said licking his lips. "Do you know what Dodgers is going to do with you if you hurt the cat?" Francis warned. "Are you going to do something to stop me?" Tito respond. Francis could do something, but he know from experience that it was just a waste of time. He could throw Tito around the room, but the little dog was like a little rubber ball that would just bounce back again. So he just said "Sure, do it. But it is on your own risk." He then told Einstein to not do anything either, so that if something bad would happen it would be all Tito´s fault.

Tito took some steps towards Oliver, who started to try and run away with Tito just behind him.
131111.title: Dodger and Rita

1311112.content:
At first it looked like it was going to be the end of Oliver. He was being chased around the house boat by Tito, and Francis and Einstein didn't do anything to help him. He could all the time from behind him hear how the little Chihuahua was screaming about how he was going to eat him. That little bit of distance that was between them also seemed to get smaller to Oliver.

All of the sudden Oliver made a wrong step and fell. All Oliver could do now was to curl up and hope or the best. Tito, how had now finally caught up with the cat laugh evilly when he saw how scared the little kitten was. He suddenly stopped laughing witch's made Oliver take the paws of his face to see why. Only to get his face clawed by Tito!

All while Tito started to walk around the scared little kitten he continues to laugh and talk superior about how Oliver is going to be his meal. What he didn't know was that while Oliver was covering his scarred face something in his head snapped. When Tito had hit him he felt how his psyche had made him first now realize that he was much bigger then this dog. It had made him feel more stronger and more furious. The dog was going to pay for what he'd done against Oliver. And with an evil smile behind his paws he knew just how.

When Tito didn't notice Oliver made a run towards a stack of junk. Tito took off after the cat, knowing that he could never forgive himself for letting a meal get away that easy. Oliver started to run up the stack and Tito followed him. When he reached the top of it he waited until Tito had almost catch's up to him, before he jumped down back to the floor. Tito who was being a bit tired from chasing him knew that he needed to be quick to follow the cat if he didn't want him to get away. But what he didn't know was that as soon as Oliver had landed and Tito had jumped after him Oliver stopped and turn around to face Tito still in mid-air. Tito could then see when he was falling against the cat that he open his mouth.

Before Tito could think he fell head first into the cats open mouth. When Oliver closed his mouth he could see that Tito's hind legs and tail still was outside him and trying to wriggle their was out. Oliver looked at Francis and Einstein who just was to shocked for the moment to do something. He gave them a evil looking smile and swallowed the rest of the little chihuahua. He then laid down on the ground with the wonderful felling of having the little dog kicking in his stomach.

"So that's the thing you told before that is called Irony?" Einstein said about the situation. This made Francis to wake up from his shock and realize what just happen. The kitten that had just fallen in to their home had just eaten their friend whole and alive. This made him really angry, and Oliver could see that it was best to escape now.
1311112.title: The tables turns.

choices: Francis and Einstein goes after Oliver.
Wait until Dodger and Rita is back.
13111121.content:
Quickly getting back on his feet Oliver tossed himself away when Francis jumped forward to catch him. He then could feel Tito inside trying his best at getting out this prison Oliver had put him in. It was very distracting to have all that movement inside going around when trying to escape the place, but Oliver just had to keep it together for the moment.

Once he dodged away from Francis Oliver made a quick dash towards the stair and the main exit out of the boat. It was guarded by Einstein, but he could see that the dog was pretty slow in the head so he had a good chance. With all his power he run up towards the Great Dane guarding, and escaped by running through the gap in between his legs. To make things better Einstein didn't even have time to try and stop him until Francis (who where cashing Oliver) was on his way of doing the same thing. This lead to Einstein pinning down the bulldog, and Oliver escaping.

"Look what you have done now!" Francis barked angrily at Einstein. "That cat just ate our friend, and now he's escaped." "But what should we do?" The Great Dane asked. "We go after him of course!" Francis said, and he was on his way to run after the cat when Einstein stopped him again. "But what will Fagin think when he comes back with Dodger and Rita if we are gone?" He asked. "If we wait we can lose the trace of the cat!" Francis said. "But if we wait we could be more looking for him." Einstein said.

What will they choose?
13111121.title: He manages to escape.

choices: Einstein get's to curious about the feeling.
13111122.content:
It wasn't easy for Oliver to run with a full belly that wouldn't stay still. While Francis was a bigger dog and therefore faster he was also more clumsy in taking turns. The door and the windows where looked. So that gave Oliver as his only way out the same window from where he had entered the houseboat from the start. The only way for him to get up there in his condition and limit of time was to race up the same junk stack that he had used for to eat Tito. He had to get to the top and jump from there to reach the edge of the window. This was his only chance of escaping.

He started his plan with running to the place where he had slipped when Tito was chasing him. If he could make Francis slipped to he would get a head start. He came to the slippery part and made sharp turn. Lucky for him Francis did fall, and those seconds it took for him to get up again was like hours for Oliver. He started to climb as fast as he could, and saw that Francis had started to run faster. At first Oliver thought it was to catch up, but then he realize that this was a part of a plan Francis had. He had figured out that Oliver tried to reach the window in the celling by climbing the junk stack. So to stop him he was going to ram the stack to make it collapse. Thereby ruining the cat's only escape route.

Oliver realized that any moment now Francis was going to hit the stack and make it crumble. He saw that his only way of having any chance making it away was to jump now, even if it seemed to not be high enough. Just as he jumped of he saw how the mark he had stood on disappeared. Flying in the air he tried to reach for the edge of the window. And he got it. While hanging from the window he found another problem he hadn't thought about before. With Tito in his stomach he was much more heavier then before. Which made it much harder for him to heave himself up. He felt so heavy that he actually could almost feel himself losing his grip. He looked down to see the bulldog watching him hanging up there, liking his lips and opening his mouth wide. That was what he was waiting for, if Oliver didn't manage to heave himself up this was going to be the end of him. He hold on for what he felt like an eternity, when the most horrible thing that could happen, happen. His paws lost it´s grip.

While he was falling he manage to turn around in the air, facing face down to see all the way down the bulldog's inside. Because he was in a much smaller size then the dog he went straight down without Francis having to even swallow, he just went from one second being in the air to deep down into a bulldog's stomach. The sudden impact it made with Oliver landing hurt Francis a little bit, but then he had such a wonderful feeling of being massaged from the inside. He then laid back and put one of his paw on the round bulge on his stomach and just stroke it feeling so relaxed.

What´s next?
13111122.title: Francis get's him.

choices: Dodger and Rita back home to see that the four they left had become one.
131111222.content:
"Does that feel good?" Einstein asked Francis. "Yes, that feels sooooo gooood." Francis answered in a tone that sounded like he had a combo of all the best massages there was at the same time. What made Francis version of the massage better then Oliver's was that while Oliver just had Tito giving him a inside belly massage, Francis could feel both Oliver's paws and Tito's pressing against the cat's belly walls in a try of escape. Seeing how absolutely gorgeous that feeling must be to Francis, Einstein wished that he to could have a try to get the same treatment. But how?

Einstein's brain wasn't used to think too much because he usually just did what the other dogs in the gang did, or did the things they told him to do. But now he had his brain working at full speed. He wanted so much too get that same god pleasant feeling like Francis. "The must be some way to get that felling as fast as possible." His brain thought. It looked like the only way for him to get the feeling was to have him eat some other living creature whole and alive. But the only living thing he could eat here was... Francis!

At first he was 100% against eating Francis, He was his friend after all. But seeing how much the bulldog seemed to love how he was now feeling made Einstein's curiosity insane. He could feel how his good conscience started to drop, even if he still felt how he would never do a thing like eating such a close friend.

But then he started to think about some times in the past when Francis hadn't been so very nice to him, like don't sharing food or making fun of his lack of intelligence. This made him want to eat him more, but he was still thinking that eating him would be such a bad thing to do. Einstein had about 30% conscience left by now.

Einstein felt inside his head how he was about to completely lose control over the situation. He tried to look away from Francis to stop thinking about it, But then it was the moans. Francis didn't only stretch and rolled like he was bragging of what luxury he had, but he was also moaning loudly about how wonderful it felt.

This made Einstein almost losing it. Just barely keeping himself from throwing over Francis and rip him to pieces. It must be about one last percent of conscience left when something happen. His own stomach growled.

All this thought about eating had made him hungry, like seriously hungry. This was all that was needed to make his decision. He was going to eat Francis.

While Francis laid on his back holding both paws on his stomach with his eyes closed, could he never guess what Einstein was about to do. All of the sudden the light from the celling was blocked. Francis opened his eyes to see Einstein staring back at him. "Oh, hi..." was all he could say before he saw the look Einstein was giving him. "W-What is it?" Francis asked a bit nervous. Without answering him Einstein opened his mouth wide and put Francis head into his mouth and swallowed. Francis would have done something quicker but the downside of having such a long massage and rest was that it made his body much slower when it came to reactions. That had done that Einstein now had the advantage of the situation.

"You can't do this! It's impossible!" Francis muffled screams said inside the beginning of Einstein's throat. He was right in that it seemed impossible because of their sizes. Einstein discovered it the hard way when he had swallowed Francis up to his big belly. It seemed hard to get this part of him through because it was the biggest part of him. He even seemed kinda stuck in there. Einstein could feel how it was getting really hard to get any air, and if he didn't manage to swallow the rest of the dog soon he would probably choke to death. Francis hind legs and tail was the only thing still hanging outside of Einstein's mouth. Einstein saw the legs and one of the walls on the house boat and got an idea. The only thing he had been known to be good at was to slam his head to walls and other hard objects. So he ran against the wall with the goal to hit it with the legs hanging out of his mouth. He managed to made a perfect hit, sending the belly and legs through his throat and down to his belly in one big motion.

He was so full and so heavy now that he had to lay down and roll over on his back. His belly was so big that it almost touched the ground when he was standing on all four. He had an entire bulldog stuffed inside his belly, with a cat inside that dog's belly, and an even smaller dog inside the cat's. Einstein could now get to feel this feeling that Francis had made him so curios about, and it felt even better then he could ever imagine. It was even better then what Francis had had because Einstein had now instead three living beings massaging him at ones because of him eating Francis. Einstein became so overwhelmed by the amazing feeling that he fell into a relaxing sleep.

When he woke up he found...

13112.title: Home at Jenny

131121.content:
As he approached the dog he looked up and greeted her, “Good morning, is something wrong?” he said in response to the dog’s intense stare. Georgette just leaned in close and whispered in Oliver’s ear “you’re going on an adventure”.

Before he could say another word she grabbed him in her jaws and walked into her room like a lion carrying her cub. Oliver kicked and meowed in protest, “put me down or I’ll tell Jenny” he sulked “where we are going anyway?”

Georgette gently put him down in her room and kicked the door closed. “Oh it’s not about where we’re going, it's about where you’re going” she smiled devilishly at Oliver confusion. His tasty scent tickled her nose and she was tempted to mess with him some more, but she had to hurry things up. “Oh you stupid animal” she laughed “I’m going to..."
131121.title: Georgette

1311211.content:
Oliver backed away as Georgette advanced with a ravenous look in her eyes. “Wait, maybe we can talk about this” he said as he backed into a corner. But Georgette was done talking; it was time to eat, she opened her jaws and lunged at Oliver.

All Oliver could do was whimper as the darkness of Georgette’s fleshy mouth enveloped his head. He was coated with Saliva as the tongue licked over his furry body; he tried to claw it away but found his paws pinned down underneath. "Wait, no! You’re eating me” he shouted as the jaws jerked forward again.

Georgette rolled her eyes and continued devouring him. Any reservations she had disappeared as the cat’s succulent flavour flooded her mouth. She closed her eyes and let out a loud moan, the cat tasted like nothing she had ever eaten before. But it wasn’t just the taste Georgette enjoyed; it was the kicking, the whimpering, the sheer power she felt from eating another creature made her feel incredible. She wished she could have a bit more time to mess with the cat, but time was running out. Georgette swung her muzzle up to the ceiling and bolted down Oliver with two quick gulps.

Panic filled poor Oliver as he was dragged down into Georgette's stomach, all of his instincts were telling him to escape but he couldn’t, he was trapped. He retched at the smell inside the belly, it smelled like dog food. As he felt the stomach acid burn his muscles he realised that was what he had become, dog food. The realisation of this and the lack of air inside the stomach made the young cat feel dizzy, he stumbled around, his vision blurring, before finally collapsing.

The stomach worked over him for the next few hours, attacking his muscles and turning him into a mushy soup. Soon all that would be left of Oliver would be an extra layer of fat on the poodle’s stomach.

Meanwhile, the poodle in question was licking her lips for the last remnants of Oliver’s flavour. She placed a paw on her enlarged stomach, feeling Oliver trying to claw his way out. “Oh shut it, nobody’s coming to help you” she belched, the taste of cat still on her lips, and lay down in her basket. The ecstasy of eating another animal and reducing it to fat beneath her skin had exhausted Georgette.

She fell asleep to the sounds of her stomach gurgling happily; working hard to digest the meat it had been given...
1311211.title: Eat you

132.content: So what does the coolest canine in New York have in store for him? Is he food, or is he looking to gulp someone into his belly?
132.title: Dodger

1321.content: So do you want to do your own story here, or read one that someone else has written?
1321.title: Dodger the Pred

13212.content:
(This takes place at the start of the movie.)

Things hadn’t started so good for Oliver. He had been the only kitten not to get adopted by a kid. He had barley had any sleep last night because he had a hard time finding a place to sleep where he was protected from rain, and when he woke up he had to deal with people, cars and an angry hot dogs salesman.

Hiding in an alley Oliver thought that things couldn’t get any worse. That’s when he heard a voice from behind. “Ooh, you sure picked the wrong guy to get hot dogs from, kid.” Oliver turned around and got a little scared when he saw that it was a dog. Other dogs that he had meet earlier had barked and tried to chase him, so he was on his guard a little against this strange. He might eat him. “G-Get away from me!” Oliver said trying to sound aggressive.

“Whoa! Chill out, man.” Dodger said, “I don’t eat cats. It´s too much fur.” (This was actually a bit of a lie. He hadn’t ever tried to eat a cat, but that doesn’t mean that he wanted to someday get a chance to taste one. The thought of tasting one had been in his mind for a long time, and it was very rare that he would find an ownerless kitten wanderings around in an alley. This was the chance he have been waiting for. He could eat him right now, but then he got an idea. Maybe he could use this cat to help him before he made him a meal.)

“But listen here” Dodger said, “All you need to do is to make a distraction, and I´ll do the rest.”

And with that Dodger started barking and chasing Oliver out of the alley. (This was all a part of Dodgers plan but Oliver didn’t know that.) In a try to escape the dog and get protection Oliver run up to Louie (The hotdog salesman) and started to climb up him. Dodger wasn’t fare behind as he started to run around the man and bark like mad after the cat. This caused the man to lose balance and fall into some garbage cans, and Dodger took the chance to take a trail of connected hotdogs and strap them around his neck as a neck less. Turning around he saw that the man wasn’t even looking at him. He was to busy trying to catch the little kitten. “This cat made things more easy for me then I thought.” Dodger thought and made a simple walk away with the hotdogs.

Later on in a construction-building site Dodger was sitting and counting on how to spilt the hotdogs with the other dog at home, when he heard something walking up behind him. It was Oliver and he didn’t look happy. “Oh hay there kitten.” Dodger said when he saw him. “Why did you leave me behind?” Oliver asked angry. Dodger answered calmly “If I had to turned back and help you, Louie would have been able to take back the hotdogs.” “Sigh. Guess you´re right:” Oliver said. “And besides, you manage to escape from him.” Dodger said. “Yeah, but only barley.” Oliver said.

Looking at the hotdogs made Oliver´s stomach growl. There were eight of them. All of them were about the same size as he was. “Wonder if I can finish even one?” Oliver thought.

Dodger saw and heard Oliver´s hunger for the hotdogs, and that reminded him of his own hunger. He could just eat this little kitten right now and then return with the hotdogs to his friends. Or he could stuff the kitten with one of the hotdogs before eating him.

What would he do?
13212.title: My story #1

132121.content:
“As tempting filling the little kitten with sausage’s is I can´t do it under this circumstances.” Dodger thought. “My friends are starving and needs all the food I can get. I have to hope that in a brighter future I can get a new chance to test this.”

Coming back to reality he saw that Oliver was on his way to eat one of the hotdogs. With a quick tug he dragged the hotdogs away from Oliver and throw them around his neck again. “What are you doing?” Oliver asked annoyed for what happened. “If you want them, come get them.” Dodger said and run of. Oliver (Who was really obsessed of eating the hotdogs now.) runs after him shouting, “Come back! I helped you get them!”

The chase went on for a little while throughout the construction—site. (Dodger didn’t want the cat to know his plan right away,) After making a quick look at the site Dodger saw the perfect place to have his meal.

He ran up some stairs and then went out on the third floor on a building with Oliver not far behind. Dodger had seen that a pile of sand was laying outside of this unfinished building, and made his way towards the sand heap. He jumped out of the building and landed safely on the sand.

He turned around and saw that Oliver was on his way. He could see in his eyes that he wanted this hotdogs more then anything else right now. He took a leap against Dodger looking like a lion throwing itself against its prey. With Oliver in the air Dodger saw his chance, and opened his mouth.

In a blink of an eye Oliver went from a furious and hunting predator to a scared and panicking prey. He knew that now when he was falling down towards Dodgers opening gap he was as helpless and vulnerable as possible. The only thing he could think out to do during this little time he had left before getting eaten was to try and attack Dodger in some way. He was going to give the dog a fight all the way into the end.

Dodger seeing this decided to not take any risks and opened his mouth more. This had the effect that when Oliver entered his mouth he went down his throat directly. There was a risk of Dodger hurting his stomach because Oliver was falling down at a very quick speed. Luckily (for Dodger at least) Dodger´s throat muscles manage to slow down Oliver´ speed enough to only make his impact feel to Dodger like had swallowed something heavy.

Looking down Dodger could see a small bulge on his belly that was Oliver. Apart of the slightly pain of Oliver landing in his belly he felt good. And with this meal he wouldn’t have to eat in almost a day.
Oliver on the other hand had it far worse. He was now in a place that is dark, wet hot, and with very little air. He tried to claw his way out but the lack of air made his effort worthless.

All of the sudden he felt his whole prison shake. Dodger had been given his belly a slap. “Hope you´re happy now kitty.” Dodger said in a irritated tone. “Because you had to play “Mr tough guy” I lost my chance on getting a great taste of you.” “Please let me out.” Oliver pleads from Dodgers insides. “ “Sorry little friend.” Dodger said. “But this city is known as “The city jungle”, and in the rules of the jungles it all about the predator eating the prey.”

And with that Dodger stopped listen to Oliver and thought about what to do now. If he was going to rest and return home once Oliver was digested. Or was he going to take the hotdogs and return now?

At home in the houseboat Tito was laying down and felt miserable. For as long as he could remember he had always been treated as the weakest link in the group. Nobody of his friends believed that he could stand up to himself in a fight. Just because he happened to be the smallest dog in the group didn't mean that he couldn't.

"If only I could do something to show them. Show them that I have what it takes to take on any kind of opponents." Tito thought to himself. But the question still remained how was he going to show that he deserved to seen as a big and powerful predator?

Just like that the halfbroken tv in the room showed a nature documentary about wild cheetahs hunting and eating it's preys.

Getting a small light-bulb over his head Tito started to form nasty idea. "The only way to prove that I should be considered a dangerous treat, is for me to fight and eat another animal. That will show them!" Tito thought as he runned out of the houseboat and dashed towards the big city.

What is Tito's main goal to catch?
